class SparsityPattern::Build
 

Detailed Description

This class handles the numbering of degrees of freedom on a mesh. For systems of equations the class supports a fixed number of variables. The degrees of freedom are numbered such that sequential, contiguous blocks belong to distinct processors. This is so that the resulting data structures will work well with parallel linear algebra packages.

Author
Benjamin S. Kirk
Date
2002-2007

Definition at line 164 of file dof_map.h.

explicit

Constructor. Requires the number of the system for which we will be numbering degrees of freedom & the parent object we are contained in, which defines our communication space.

Member Function Documentation

void libMesh::DofMap::_dof_indices ( const Elem *const  elem,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  di,
const unsigned int  v,
const Node *const *  nodes,
unsigned int n_nodes#ifdef  DEBUG,
std::size_t &tot_size#  endif 
) const
private

Helper function that gets the dof indices on the current element for a non-SCALAR type variable.

Parameters
tot_sizeIn DEBUG mode this will add up the total number of dof indices that should have been added to di.

2007  const Node* node = nodes[n];
2008 
2009  // There is a potential problem with h refinement. Imagine a
2010  // quad9 that has a linear FE on it. Then, on the hanging side,
2011  // it can falsely identify a DOF at the mid-edge node. This is why
2012  // we call FEInterface instead of node->n_comp() directly.
2013  const unsigned int nc = FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node (dim,
2014  fe_type,
2015  type,
2016  n);
2017 
2018  // If this is a non-vertex on a hanging node with extra
2019  // degrees of freedom, we use the non-vertex dofs (which
2020  // come in reverse order starting from the end, to
2021  // simplify p refinement)
2022  if (extra_hanging_dofs && !elem->is_vertex(n))
2023  {
2024  const int dof_offset = node->n_comp(sys_num,v) - nc;
2025 
2026  // We should never have fewer dofs than necessary on a
2027  // node unless we're getting indices on a parent element,
2028  // and we should never need the indices on such a node
2029  if (dof_offset < 0)
2030  {
2031  libmesh_assert(!elem->active());
2032  di.resize(di.size() + nc, DofObject::invalid_id);
2033  }
2034  else
2035  for (int i=node->n_comp(sys_num,v)-1; i>=dof_offset; i--)
2036  {
2037  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (node->dof_number(sys_num,v,i),
2038  DofObject::invalid_id);
2039  di.push_back(node->dof_number(sys_num,v,i));
2040  }
2041  }
2042  // If this is a vertex or an element without extra hanging
2043  // dofs, our dofs come in forward order coming from the
2044  // beginning
2045  else
2046  for (unsigned int i=0; i<nc; i++)
2047  {
2048  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (node->dof_number(sys_num,v,i),
2049  DofObject::invalid_id);
2050  di.push_back(node->dof_number(sys_num,v,i));
2051  }
2052  }
2053 
2054  // If there are any element-based DOF numbers, get them
2055  const unsigned int nc = FEInterface::n_dofs_per_elem(dim,
2056  fe_type,
2057  type);
2058  // We should never have fewer dofs than necessary on an
2059  // element unless we're getting indices on a parent element,
2060  // and we should never need those indices
2061  if (nc != 0)
2062  {
2063  if (elem->n_systems() > sys_num &&
2064  nc <= elem->n_comp(sys_num,v))
2065  {
2066  for (unsigned int i=0; i<nc; i++)
2067  {
2068  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (elem->dof_number(sys_num,v,i),
2069  DofObject::invalid_id);
2070 
2071  di.push_back(elem->dof_number(sys_num,v,i));
2072  }
2073  }
2074  else
2075  {
2076  libmesh_assert(!elem->active() || fe_type.family == LAGRANGE || fe_type.family == SUBDIVISION);
2077  di.resize(di.size() + nc, DofObject::invalid_id);
2078  }
2079  }
2080  }
2081 }

void libMesh::DofMap::add_adjoint_constraint_row ( const unsigned int  qoi_index,
const dof_id_type  dof_number,
const DofConstraintRow &  constraint_row,
const Number  constraint_rhs,
const bool  forbid_constraint_overwrite 
)

Adds a copy of the user-defined row to the constraint matrix, using an inhomogeneous right-hand-side for the adjoint constraint equation.

forbid_constraint_overwrite here only tests for overwriting the rhs. This method should only be used when an equivalent constraint (with a potentially different rhs) already exists for the primal problem.

Definition at line 1205 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

1210 {
1211  // Optionally allow the user to overwrite constraints. Defaults to false.
1212  if (forbid_constraint_overwrite)
1213  {
1214  if (!this->is_constrained_dof(dof_number))
1215  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: DOF " << dof_number << " has no corresponding primal constraint!");
1216 #ifndef NDEBUG
1217  // No way to do this without a non-normalized tolerance?
1218  /*
1219  // If the user passed in more than just the rhs, let's check the
1220  // coefficients for consistency
1221  if (!constraint_row.empty())
1222  {
1223  DofConstraintRow row = _dof_constraints[dof_number];
1224  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator pos=row.begin();
1225  pos != row.end(); ++pos)
1226  {
1227  libmesh_assert(constraint_row.find(pos->first)->second
1228  == pos->second);
1229  }
1230  }
1231 
1232  if (_adjoint_constraint_values[qoi_index].find(dof_number) !=
1233  _adjoint_constraint_values[qoi_index].end())
1234  libmesh_assert_equal_to
1235  (_adjoint_constraint_values[qoi_index][dof_number],
1236  constraint_rhs);
1237  */
1238 #endif
1239  }
1240 
1241  // Creates the map of rhs values if it doesn't already exist; then
1242  // adds the current value to that map
1243  _adjoint_constraint_values[qoi_index].insert(std::make_pair(dof_number, constraint_rhs));
1244 }

Adds a copy of the user-defined row to the constraint matrix, using a homogeneous right-hand-side for the constraint equation. By default, produces an error if the DOF was already constrained.

void libMesh::DofMap::add_constraints_to_send_list ( )
private

Adds entries to the _send_list vector corresponding to DoFs which are dependencies for constraint equations on the current processor.

3684 {
3685  // This function must be run on all processors at once
3686  parallel_object_only();
3687 
3688  // Return immediately if there's nothing to gather
3689  if (this->n_processors() == 1)
3690  return;
3691 
3692  // We might get to return immediately if none of the processors
3693  // found any constraints
3694  unsigned int has_constraints = !_dof_constraints.empty();
3695  this->comm().max(has_constraints);
3696  if (!has_constraints)
3697  return;
3698

3701  {
3702  dof_id_type constrained_dof = i->first;
3703

3705  if (constrained_dof < this->first_dof() ||
3706  constrained_dof >= this->end_dof())
3707  continue;
3708

3715

3718  constraint_dependency < this->end_dof())
3719  continue;

private

Adds entries to the _send_list vector corresponding to DoFs on elements neighboring the current processor.

1403 {
1404  START_LOG("add_neighbors_to_send_list()", "DofMap");
1405 
1406  const unsigned int sys_num = this->sys_number();
1407 
1408  //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1409  // We need to add the DOFs from elements that live on neighboring processors
1410  // that are neighbors of the elements on the local processor
1411  //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1412 
1413  MeshBase::const_element_iterator local_elem_it
1414  = mesh.active_local_elements_begin();
1415  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator local_elem_end
1416  = mesh.active_local_elements_end();
1417 
1418  std::vector<bool> node_on_processor(mesh.max_node_id(), false);
1419  std::vector<dof_id_type> di;
1420  std::vector<const Elem *> family;
1421 
1422  // Loop over the active local elements, adding all active elements
1423  // that neighbor an active local element to the send list.
1424  for ( ; local_elem_it != local_elem_end; ++local_elem_it)
1425  {
1426  const Elem* elem = *local_elem_it;
1427 
1428  // We may have non-local SCALAR dofs on a local element.
1429  // Normally we'd catch those on neighboring elements, but it's
1430  // possible that the neighbors are of different subdomains and
1431  // the SCALAR isn't supported on them.
1432  for (unsigned int v=0; v<this->n_variables(); v++)
1433  if(this->variable(v).type().family == SCALAR &&
1434  this->variable(v).active_on_subdomain(elem->subdomain_id()))
1435  {
1436  // We asked for this variable, so add it to the vector.
1437  std::vector<dof_id_type> di_new;
1438  this->SCALAR_dof_indices(di_new,v);
1439  for (unsigned int i=0; i != di_new.size(); ++i)
1440  {
1441  const dof_id_type dof_index = di_new[i];
1442 
1443  if (dof_index < this->first_dof() ||
1444  dof_index >= this->end_dof())
1445  _send_list.push_back(dof_index);
1446  }
1447  }
1448 
1449  // We may have non-local nodes on a local element.
1450  for (unsigned int n=0; n!=elem->n_nodes(); n++)
1451  {
1452  // Flag all the nodes of active local elements as seen, so
1453  // we can add nodal neighbor dofs to the send_list later.
1454  node_on_processor[elem->node(n)] = true;
1455 
1456  // Add all remote dofs on these nodes to the send_list.
1457  // This is necessary in case those dofs are *not* also dofs
1458  // on neighbors; e.g. in the case of a HIERARCHIC's local
1459  // side which is only a vertex on the neighbor that owns it.
1460  const Node* node = elem->get_node(n);
1461  const unsigned n_vars = node->n_vars(sys_num);
1462  for (unsigned int v=0; v != n_vars; ++v)
1463  {
1464  const unsigned int n_comp = node->n_comp(sys_num, v);
1465  for (unsigned int c=0; c != n_comp; ++c)
1466  {
1467  const dof_id_type dof_index = node->dof_number(sys_num, v, c);
1468  if (dof_index < this->first_dof() || dof_index >= this->end_dof())
1469  {
1470  _send_list.push_back(dof_index);
1471  // libmesh_here();
1472  // libMesh::out << "sys_num,v,c,dof_index="
1473  // << sys_num << ", "
1474  // << v << ", "
1475  // << c << ", "
1476  // << dof_index << '\n';
1477  // node->debug_buffer();
1478  }
1479  }
1480  }
1481  }
1482 
1483  // Loop over the neighbors of those elements
1484  for (unsigned int s=0; s<elem->n_neighbors(); s++)
1485  if (elem->neighbor(s) != NULL)
1486  {
1487  family.clear();
1488 
1489  // Find all the active elements that neighbor elem
1490 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1491  if (!elem->neighbor(s)->active())
1492  elem->neighbor(s)->active_family_tree_by_neighbor(family, elem);
1493  else
1494 #endif
1495  family.push_back(elem->neighbor(s));
1496 
1497  for (dof_id_type i=0; i!=family.size(); ++i)
1498  // If the neighbor lives on a different processor
1499  if (family[i]->processor_id() != this->processor_id())
1500  {
1501  // Get the DOF indices for this neighboring element
1502  this->dof_indices (family[i], di);
1503 
1504  // Insert the remote DOF indices into the send list
1505  for (std::size_t j=0; j != di.size(); ++j)
1506  if (di[j] < this->first_dof() ||
1507  di[j] >= this->end_dof())
1508  _send_list.push_back(di[j]);
1509  }
1510  }
1511  }
1512 
1513  // Now loop over all non_local active elements and add any missing
1514  // nodal-only neighbors. This will also get any dofs from nonlocal
1515  // nodes on local elements, because every nonlocal node exists on a
1516  // nonlocal nodal neighbor element.
1517  MeshBase::const_element_iterator elem_it
1518  = mesh.active_elements_begin();
1519  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator elem_end
1520  = mesh.active_elements_end();
1521 
1522  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
1523  {
1524  const Elem* elem = *elem_it;
1525 
1526  // If this is one of our elements, we've already added it
1527  if (elem->processor_id() == this->processor_id())
1528  continue;
1529 
1530  // Do we need to add the element DOFs?
1531  bool add_elem_dofs = false;
1532 
1533  // Check all the nodes of the element to see if it
1534  // shares a node with us
1535  for (unsigned int n=0; n!=elem->n_nodes(); n++)
1536  if (node_on_processor[elem->node(n)])
1537  add_elem_dofs = true;
1538 
1539  // Add the element degrees of freedom if it shares at
1540  // least one node.
1541  if (add_elem_dofs)
1542  {
1543  // Get the DOF indices for this neighboring element
1544  this->dof_indices (elem, di);
1545 
1546  // Insert the remote DOF indices into the send list
1547  for (std::size_t j=0; j != di.size(); ++j)
1548  if (di[j] < this->first_dof() ||
1549  di[j] >= this->end_dof())
1550  _send_list.push_back(di[j]);
1551  }
1552  }
1553 
1554  STOP_LOG("add_neighbors_to_send_list()", "DofMap");
1555 }

void libMesh::DofMap::add_periodic_boundary ( const PeriodicBoundaryBase &  periodic_boundary)

Adds a copy of the specified periodic boundary to the system.

3908  // See if we already have a periodic boundary associated myboundary...
3909  PeriodicBoundaryBase* existing_boundary = _periodic_boundaries->boundary(periodic_boundary.myboundary);
3910 
3911  if ( existing_boundary == NULL )
3912  {
3913  // ...if not, clone the input (and its inverse) and add them to the PeriodicBoundaries object
3914  PeriodicBoundaryBase* boundary = periodic_boundary.clone().release();
3915  PeriodicBoundaryBase* inverse_boundary = periodic_boundary.clone(PeriodicBoundaryBase::INVERSE).release();

3917  // _periodic_boundaries takes ownership of the pointers
3918  _periodic_boundaries->insert(std::make_pair(boundary->myboundary, boundary));
3919  _periodic_boundaries->insert(std::make_pair(inverse_boundary->myboundary, inverse_boundary));
3920  }

3923  // ...otherwise, merge this object's variable IDs with the existing boundary object's.
3924  existing_boundary->merge(periodic_boundary);

)

Add a periodic boundary pair

Parameters
boundary- primary boundary

Definition at line 3936 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::PeriodicBoundaryBase::clone(), libMesh::PeriodicBoundaryBase::myboundary, and libMesh::PeriodicBoundaryBase::pairedboundary.

3937 {
3938  libmesh_assert_equal_to (boundary.myboundary, inverse_boundary.pairedboundary);
3939  libmesh_assert_equal_to (boundary.pairedboundary, inverse_boundary.myboundary);
3940 
3941  // Allocate copies on the heap. The _periodic_boundaries object will manage this memory.
3942  // Note: this also means that the copy constructor for the PeriodicBoundary (or user class
3943  // derived therefrom) must be implemented!
3944  // PeriodicBoundary* p_boundary = new PeriodicBoundary(boundary);
3945  // PeriodicBoundary* p_inverse_boundary = new PeriodicBoundary(inverse_boundary);
3946 
3947  // We can't use normal copy construction since this leads to slicing with derived classes.
3948  // Use clone() "virtual constructor" instead. But, this *requires* user to override the clone()
3949  // method. Note also that clone() allocates memory. In this case, the _periodic_boundaries object
3950  // takes responsibility for cleanup.
3951  PeriodicBoundaryBase* p_boundary = boundary.clone().release();
3952  PeriodicBoundaryBase* p_inverse_boundary = inverse_boundary.clone().release();
3953 
3954  // Add the periodic boundary and its inverse to the PeriodicBoundaries data structure. The
3955  // PeriodicBoundaries data structure takes ownership of the pointers.
3956  _periodic_boundaries->insert(std::make_pair(p_boundary->myboundary, p_boundary));
3957  _periodic_boundaries->insert(std::make_pair(p_inverse_boundary->myboundary, p_inverse_boundary));
3958 }

bool libMesh::DofMap::all_semilocal_indices ( const std::vector< dof_id_type > &  dof_indices) const

Returns true iff all degree of freedom indices in dof_indices are either local indices or in the send_list. Note that this is an O(logN) operation, not O(1); we don't cache enough information for O(1) right now.

Definition at line 2123 of file dof_map.C.

References _send_list, end_dof(), and first_dof().

2124 {
2125  // We're all semilocal unless we find a counterexample
2126  for (std::size_t i=0; i != dof_indices_in.size(); ++i)
2127  {
2128  const dof_id_type di = dof_indices_in[i];
2129  // If it's not in the local indices
2130  if (di < this->first_dof() ||
2131  di >= this->end_dof())
2132  {
2133  // and if it's not in the ghost indices, then we're not
2134  // semilocal
2135  if (!std::binary_search(_send_list.begin(), _send_list.end(), di))
2136  return false;
2137  }
2138  }
2139 
2140  return true;
2141 }

void libMesh::DofMap::allgather_recursive_constraints ( MeshBase &  mesh)

Gathers constraint equation dependencies from other processors

Definition at line 2477 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::active_not_local_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_not_local_elements_end(), libMesh::comm, libMesh::DofObject::dof_number(), end, libMesh::for(), libMesh::Elem::get_node(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::libmesh_isnan(), mesh, libMesh::DofObject::n_comp(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::n_processors(), n_vars, libMesh::DofObject::n_vars(), libMesh::Elem::node(), libMesh::MeshBase::node_ptr(), libMesh::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), and libMesh::TypeVector< T >::size().

2478 {
2479  // This function must be run on all processors at once
2480  parallel_object_only();
2481 
2482  // Return immediately if there's nothing to gather
2483  if (this->n_processors() == 1)
2484  return;
2485 
2486  // We might get to return immediately if none of the processors
2487  // found any constraints
2488  unsigned int has_constraints = !_dof_constraints.empty()
2489 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2490  || !_node_constraints.empty()
2491 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2492  ;
2493  this->comm().max(has_constraints);
2494  if (!has_constraints)
2495  return;
2496 
2497  // If we have heterogenous adjoint constraints we need to
2498  // communicate those too.
2499  const unsigned int max_qoi_num =
2500  _adjoint_constraint_values.empty() ?
2501  0 : _adjoint_constraint_values.rbegin()->first;
2502 
2503  // We might have calculated constraints for constrained dofs
2504  // which have support on other processors.
2505  // Push these out first.
2506  {
2507  std::vector<std::set<dof_id_type> > pushed_ids(this->n_processors());
2508 
2509 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2510  std::vector<std::set<dof_id_type> > pushed_node_ids(this->n_processors());
2511 #endif
2512 
2513  const unsigned int sys_num = this->sys_number();
2514 
2515  MeshBase::element_iterator
2516  foreign_elem_it = mesh.active_not_local_elements_begin(),
2517  foreign_elem_end = mesh.active_not_local_elements_end();
2518 
2519  // Collect the constraints to push to each processor
2520  for (; foreign_elem_it != foreign_elem_end; ++foreign_elem_it)
2521  {
2522  const Elem *elem = *foreign_elem_it;
2523 
2524  // Just checking dof_indices on the foreign element isn't
2525  // enough. Consider a central hanging node between a coarse
2526  // Q2/Q1 element and its finer neighbors on a higher-ranked
2527  // processor. The coarse element's processor will own the node,
2528  // and will thereby own the pressure dof on that node, despite
2529  // the fact that that pressure dof doesn't directly exist on the
2530  // coarse element!
2531  //
2532  // So, we loop through dofs manually.
2533 
2534  {
2535  const unsigned int n_vars = elem->n_vars(sys_num);
2536  for (unsigned int v=0; v != n_vars; ++v)
2537  {
2538  const unsigned int n_comp = elem->n_comp(sys_num,v);
2539  for (unsigned int c=0; c != n_comp; ++c)
2540  {
2541  const unsigned int id =
2542  elem->dof_number(sys_num,v,c);
2543  if (this->is_constrained_dof(id))
2544  pushed_ids[elem->processor_id()].insert(id);
2545  }
2546  }
2547  }
2548 
2549  for (unsigned int n=0; n != elem->n_nodes(); ++n)
2550  {
2551  const Node *node = elem->get_node(n);
2552  const unsigned int n_vars = node->n_vars(sys_num);
2553  for (unsigned int v=0; v != n_vars; ++v)
2554  {
2555  const unsigned int n_comp = node->n_comp(sys_num,v);
2556  for (unsigned int c=0; c != n_comp; ++c)
2557  {
2558  const unsigned int id =
2559  node->dof_number(sys_num,v,c);
2560  if (this->is_constrained_dof(id))
2561  pushed_ids[elem->processor_id()].insert(id);
2562  }
2563  }
2564  }
2565 
2566 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2567  for (unsigned int n=0; n != elem->n_nodes(); ++n)
2568  if (this->is_constrained_node(elem->get_node(n)))
2569  pushed_node_ids[elem->processor_id()].insert(elem->node(n));
2570 #endif
2571  }
2572 
2573  // Now trade constraint rows
2574  for (processor_id_type p = 0; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
2575  {
2576  // Push to processor procup while receiving from procdown
2577  processor_id_type procup =
2578  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->processor_id() + p) %
2579  this->n_processors());
2580  processor_id_type procdown =
2581  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->n_processors() +
2582  this->processor_id() - p) %
2583  this->n_processors());
2584 
2585  // Pack the dof constraint rows and rhs's to push to procup
2586  const std::size_t pushed_ids_size = pushed_ids[procup].size();
2587  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_keys(pushed_ids_size);
2588  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_vals(pushed_ids_size);
2589  std::vector<Number> pushed_rhss(pushed_ids_size);
2590 
2591  std::vector<std::vector<Number> >
2592  pushed_adj_rhss(max_qoi_num,
2593  std::vector<Number>(pushed_ids_size));
2594  std::set<dof_id_type>::const_iterator it = pushed_ids[procup].begin();
2595  for (std::size_t i = 0; it != pushed_ids[procup].end();
2596  ++i, ++it)
2597  {
2598  const dof_id_type pushed_id = *it;
2599  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[pushed_id];
2600  std::size_t row_size = row.size();
2601  pushed_keys[i].reserve(row_size);
2602  pushed_vals[i].reserve(row_size);
2603  for (DofConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
2604  j != row.end(); ++j)
2605  {
2606  pushed_keys[i].push_back(j->first);
2607  pushed_vals[i].push_back(j->second);
2608  }
2609 
2610  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
2611  _primal_constraint_values.find(pushed_id);
2612  pushed_rhss[i] =
2613  (rhsit == _primal_constraint_values.end()) ?
2614  0 : rhsit->second;
2615 
2616  for (unsigned int q = 0; q != max_qoi_num; ++q)
2617  {
2618  AdjointDofConstraintValues::const_iterator adjoint_map_it =
2619  _adjoint_constraint_values.find(q);
2620 
2621  if (adjoint_map_it == _adjoint_constraint_values.end())
2622  continue;
2623 
2624  const DofConstraintValueMap &constraint_map =
2625  adjoint_map_it->second;
2626 
2627  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
2628  constraint_map.find(pushed_id);
2629 
2630  pushed_adj_rhss[q][i] =
2631  (rhsit == constraint_map.end()) ?
2632  0 : rhsit->second;
2633  }
2634  }
2635 
2636 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2637  // Pack the node constraint rows to push to procup
2638  const std::size_t pushed_nodes_size = pushed_node_ids[procup].size();
2639  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_node_keys(pushed_nodes_size);
2640  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_node_vals(pushed_nodes_size);
2641  std::vector<Point> pushed_node_offsets(pushed_nodes_size);
2642  std::set<dof_id_type>::const_iterator node_it = pushed_node_ids[procup].begin();
2643  for (std::size_t i = 0; node_it != pushed_node_ids[procup].end();
2644  ++i, ++node_it)
2645  {
2646  const Node *node = mesh.node_ptr(*node_it);
2647  NodeConstraintRow &row = _node_constraints[node].first;
2648  std::size_t row_size = row.size();
2649  pushed_node_keys[i].reserve(row_size);
2650  pushed_node_vals[i].reserve(row_size);
2651  for (NodeConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
2652  j != row.end(); ++j)
2653  {
2654  pushed_node_keys[i].push_back(j->first->id());
2655  pushed_node_vals[i].push_back(j->second);
2656  }
2657  pushed_node_offsets[i] = _node_constraints[node].second;
2658  }
2659 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2660 
2661  // Trade pushed dof constraint rows
2662  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_ids_from_me
2663  (pushed_ids[procup].begin(), pushed_ids[procup].end());
2664  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_ids_to_me;
2665  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_keys_to_me;
2666  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_vals_to_me;
2667  std::vector<Number> pushed_rhss_to_me;
2668  std::vector<std::vector<Number> > pushed_adj_rhss_to_me;
2669  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_ids_from_me,
2670  procdown, pushed_ids_to_me);
2671  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_keys,
2672  procdown, pushed_keys_to_me);
2673  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_vals,
2674  procdown, pushed_vals_to_me);
2675  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_rhss,
2676  procdown, pushed_rhss_to_me);
2677  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_adj_rhss,
2678  procdown, pushed_adj_rhss_to_me);
2679  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_keys_to_me.size());
2680  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_vals_to_me.size());
2681  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_rhss_to_me.size());
2682 
2683 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2684  // Trade pushed node constraint rows
2685  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_node_ids_from_me
2686  (pushed_node_ids[procup].begin(), pushed_node_ids[procup].end());
2687  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_node_ids_to_me;
2688  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_node_keys_to_me;
2689  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_node_vals_to_me;
2690  std::vector<Point> pushed_node_offsets_to_me;
2691  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_ids_from_me,
2692  procdown, pushed_node_ids_to_me);
2693  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_keys,
2694  procdown, pushed_node_keys_to_me);
2695  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_vals,
2696  procdown, pushed_node_vals_to_me);
2697  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_offsets,
2698  procdown, pushed_node_offsets_to_me);
2699 
2700  // Note that we aren't doing a send_receive on the Nodes
2701  // themselves. At this point we should only be pushing out
2702  // "raw" constraints, and there should be no
2703  // constrained-by-constrained-by-etc. situations that could
2704  // involve non-semilocal nodes.
2705 
2706  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_node_keys_to_me.size());
2707  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_node_vals_to_me.size());
2708  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_node_offsets_to_me.size());
2709 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2710 
2711  // Add the dof constraints that I've been sent
2712  for (std::size_t i = 0; i != pushed_ids_to_me.size(); ++i)
2713  {
2714  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_keys_to_me[i].size(), pushed_vals_to_me[i].size());
2715 
2716  dof_id_type constrained = pushed_ids_to_me[i];
2717 
2718  // If we don't already have a constraint for this dof,
2719  // add the one we were sent
2720  if (!this->is_constrained_dof(constrained))
2721  {
2722  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[constrained];
2723  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != pushed_keys_to_me[i].size(); ++j)
2724  {
2725  row[pushed_keys_to_me[i][j]] = pushed_vals_to_me[i][j];
2726  }
2727  if (libmesh_isnan(pushed_rhss_to_me[i]))
2728  libmesh_assert(pushed_keys_to_me[i].empty());
2729  if (pushed_rhss_to_me[i] != Number(0))
2730  _primal_constraint_values[constrained] = pushed_rhss_to_me[i];
2731  else
2732  _primal_constraint_values.erase(constrained);
2733 
2734  for (unsigned int q = 0; q != max_qoi_num; ++q)
2735  {
2736  AdjointDofConstraintValues::iterator adjoint_map_it =
2737  _adjoint_constraint_values.find(q);
2738 
2739  if ((adjoint_map_it == _adjoint_constraint_values.end()) &&
2740  pushed_adj_rhss_to_me[q][constrained] == Number(0))
2741  continue;
2742 
2743  if (adjoint_map_it == _adjoint_constraint_values.end())
2744  adjoint_map_it = _adjoint_constraint_values.insert
2745  (std::make_pair(q,DofConstraintValueMap())).first;
2746 
2747  DofConstraintValueMap &constraint_map =
2748  adjoint_map_it->second;
2749 
2750  if (pushed_adj_rhss_to_me[q][i] != Number(0))
2751  constraint_map[constrained] =
2752  pushed_adj_rhss_to_me[q][i];
2753  else
2754  constraint_map.erase(constrained);
2755  }
2756  }
2757  }
2758 
2759 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2760  // Add the node constraints that I've been sent
2761  for (std::size_t i = 0; i != pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(); ++i)
2762  {
2763  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_keys_to_me[i].size(), pushed_node_vals_to_me[i].size());
2764 
2765  dof_id_type constrained_id = pushed_node_ids_to_me[i];
2766 
2767  // If we don't already have a constraint for this node,
2768  // add the one we were sent
2769  const Node *constrained = mesh.node_ptr(constrained_id);
2770  if (!this->is_constrained_node(constrained))
2771  {
2772  NodeConstraintRow &row = _node_constraints[constrained].first;
2773  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != pushed_node_keys_to_me[i].size(); ++j)
2774  {
2775  const Node *key_node = mesh.node_ptr(pushed_node_keys_to_me[i][j]);
2776  libmesh_assert(key_node);
2777  row[key_node] = pushed_node_vals_to_me[i][j];
2778  }
2779  _node_constraints[constrained].second = pushed_node_offsets_to_me[i];
2780  }
2781  }
2782 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2783  }
2784  }
2785 
2786  // Now start checking for any other constraints we need
2787  // to know about, requesting them recursively.
2788 
2789  // Create sets containing the DOFs and nodes we already depend on
2790  typedef std::set<dof_id_type> DoF_RCSet;
2791  DoF_RCSet unexpanded_dofs;
2792 
2793  for (DofConstraints::iterator i = _dof_constraints.begin();
2794  i != _dof_constraints.end(); ++i)
2795  {
2796  unexpanded_dofs.insert(i->first);
2797  }
2798 
2799  typedef std::set<const Node *> Node_RCSet;
2800  Node_RCSet unexpanded_nodes;
2801 
2802 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2803  for (NodeConstraints::iterator i = _node_constraints.begin();
2804  i != _node_constraints.end(); ++i)
2805  {
2806  unexpanded_nodes.insert(i->first);
2807  }
2808 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2809 
2810  // We have to keep recursing while the unexpanded set is
2811  // nonempty on *any* processor
2812  bool unexpanded_set_nonempty = !unexpanded_dofs.empty() ||
2813  !unexpanded_nodes.empty();
2814  this->comm().max(unexpanded_set_nonempty);
2815 
2816  while (unexpanded_set_nonempty)
2817  {
2818  // Let's make sure we don't lose sync in this loop.
2819  parallel_object_only();
2820 
2821  // Request sets
2822  DoF_RCSet dof_request_set;
2823  Node_RCSet node_request_set;
2824 
2825  // Request sets to send to each processor
2826  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> >
2827  requested_dof_ids(this->n_processors()),
2828  requested_node_ids(this->n_processors());
2829 
2830  // And the sizes of each
2831  std::vector<dof_id_type>
2832  dof_ids_on_proc(this->n_processors(), 0),
2833  node_ids_on_proc(this->n_processors(), 0);
2834 
2835  // Fill (and thereby sort and uniq!) the main request sets
2836  for (DoF_RCSet::iterator i = unexpanded_dofs.begin();
2837  i != unexpanded_dofs.end(); ++i)
2838  {
2839  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[*i];
2840  for (DofConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
2841  j != row.end(); ++j)
2842  {
2843  const dof_id_type constraining_dof = j->first;
2844 
2845  // If it's non-local and we haven't already got a
2846  // constraint for it, we might need to ask for one
2847  if (((constraining_dof < this->first_dof()) ||
2848  (constraining_dof >= this->end_dof())) &&
2849  !_dof_constraints.count(constraining_dof))
2850  dof_request_set.insert(constraining_dof);
2851  }
2852  }
2853 
2854 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2855  for (Node_RCSet::iterator i = unexpanded_nodes.begin();
2856  i != unexpanded_nodes.end(); ++i)
2857  {
2858  NodeConstraintRow &row = _node_constraints[*i].first;
2859  for (NodeConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
2860  j != row.end(); ++j)
2861  {
2862  const Node* const node = j->first;
2863  libmesh_assert(node);
2864 
2865  // If it's non-local and we haven't already got a
2866  // constraint for it, we might need to ask for one
2867  if ((node->processor_id() != this->processor_id()) &&
2868  !_node_constraints.count(node))
2869  node_request_set.insert(node);
2870  }
2871  }
2872 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
2873 
2874  // Clear the unexpanded constraint sets; we're about to expand
2875  // them
2876  unexpanded_dofs.clear();
2877  unexpanded_nodes.clear();
2878 
2879  // Count requests by processor
2880  processor_id_type proc_id = 0;
2881  for (DoF_RCSet::iterator i = dof_request_set.begin();
2882  i != dof_request_set.end(); ++i)
2883  {
2884  while (*i >= _end_df[proc_id])
2885  proc_id++;
2886  dof_ids_on_proc[proc_id]++;
2887  }
2888 
2889  for (Node_RCSet::iterator i = node_request_set.begin();
2890  i != node_request_set.end(); ++i)
2891  {
2892  libmesh_assert(*i);
2893  libmesh_assert_less ((*i)->processor_id(), this->n_processors());
2894  node_ids_on_proc[(*i)->processor_id()]++;
2895  }
2896 
2897  for (processor_id_type p = 0; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
2898  {
2899  requested_dof_ids[p].reserve(dof_ids_on_proc[p]);
2900  requested_node_ids[p].reserve(node_ids_on_proc[p]);
2901  }
2902 
2903  // Prepare each processor's request set
2904  proc_id = 0;
2905  for (DoF_RCSet::iterator i = dof_request_set.begin();
2906  i != dof_request_set.end(); ++i)
2907  {
2908  while (*i >= _end_df[proc_id])
2909  proc_id++;
2910  requested_dof_ids[proc_id].push_back(*i);
2911  }
2912 
2913  for (Node_RCSet::iterator i = node_request_set.begin();
2914  i != node_request_set.end(); ++i)
2915  {
2916  requested_node_ids[(*i)->processor_id()].push_back((*i)->id());
2917  }
2918 
2919  // Now request constraint rows from other processors
2920  for (processor_id_type p=1; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
2921  {
2922  // Trade my requests with processor procup and procdown
2923  processor_id_type procup =
2924  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->processor_id() + p) %
2925  this->n_processors());
2926  processor_id_type procdown =
2927  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->n_processors() +
2928  this->processor_id() - p) %
2929  this->n_processors());
2930  std::vector<dof_id_type> dof_request_to_fill,
2931  node_request_to_fill;
2932 
2933  this->comm().send_receive(procup, requested_dof_ids[procup],
2934  procdown, dof_request_to_fill);
2935  this->comm().send_receive(procup, requested_node_ids[procup],
2936  procdown, node_request_to_fill);
2937 
2938  // Fill those requests
2939  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > dof_row_keys(dof_request_to_fill.size()),
2940  node_row_keys(node_request_to_fill.size());
2941 
2942  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > dof_row_vals(dof_request_to_fill.size()),
2943  node_row_vals(node_request_to_fill.size());
2944  std::vector<Number> dof_row_rhss(dof_request_to_fill.size());
2945  std::vector<std::vector<Number> >
2946  dof_adj_rhss(max_qoi_num,
2947  std::vector<Number>(dof_request_to_fill.size()));
2948  std::vector<Point> node_row_rhss(node_request_to_fill.size());
2949  for (std::size_t i=0; i != dof_request_to_fill.size(); ++i)
2950  {
2951  dof_id_type constrained = dof_request_to_fill[i];
2952  if (_dof_constraints.count(constrained))
2953  {
2954  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[constrained];
2955  std::size_t row_size = row.size();
2956  dof_row_keys[i].reserve(row_size);
2957  dof_row_vals[i].reserve(row_size);
2958  for (DofConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
2959  j != row.end(); ++j)
2960  {
2961  dof_row_keys[i].push_back(j->first);
2962  dof_row_vals[i].push_back(j->second);
2963 
2964  // We should never have a 0 constraint
2965  // coefficient; that's implicit via sparse
2966  // constraint storage
2967  libmesh_assert(j->second);
2968  }
2969  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
2970  _primal_constraint_values.find(constrained);
2971  dof_row_rhss[i] = (rhsit == _primal_constraint_values.end()) ?
2972  0 : rhsit->second;
2973 
2974  for (unsigned int q = 0; q != max_qoi_num; ++q)
2975  {
2976  AdjointDofConstraintValues::const_iterator adjoint_map_it =
2977  _adjoint_constraint_values.find(q);
2978 
2979  if (adjoint_map_it == _adjoint_constraint_values.end())
2980  continue;
2981 
2982  const DofConstraintValueMap &constraint_map =
2983  adjoint_map_it->second;
2984 
2985  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
2986  constraint_map.find(constrained);
2987  dof_adj_rhss[q][i] = (rhsit == constraint_map.end()) ?
2988  0 : rhsit->second;
2989  }
2990  }
2991  else
2992  {
2993  // Get NaN from Real, where it should exist, not
2994  // from Number, which may be std::complex, in which
2995  // case quiet_NaN() silently returns zero, rather
2996  // than sanely returning NaN or throwing an
2997  // exception or sending Stroustrop hate mail.
2998  dof_row_rhss[i] =
2999  std::numeric_limits<Real>::quiet_NaN();
3000 
3001  // Make sure we don't get caught by "!isnan(NaN)"
3002  // bugs again.
3003  libmesh_assert(libmesh_isnan(dof_row_rhss[i]));
3004  }
3005  }
3006 
3007 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3008  // FIXME - this could be an unordered set, given a
3009  // hash<pointers> specialization
3010  std::set<const Node*> nodes_requested;
3011 
3012  for (std::size_t i=0; i != node_request_to_fill.size(); ++i)
3013  {
3014  dof_id_type constrained_id = node_request_to_fill[i];
3015  const Node *constrained_node = mesh.node_ptr(constrained_id);
3016  if (_node_constraints.count(constrained_node))
3017  {
3018  const NodeConstraintRow &row = _node_constraints[constrained_node].first;
3019  std::size_t row_size = row.size();
3020  node_row_keys[i].reserve(row_size);
3021  node_row_vals[i].reserve(row_size);
3022  for (NodeConstraintRow::const_iterator j = row.begin();
3023  j != row.end(); ++j)
3024  {
3025  const Node* node = j->first;
3026  node_row_keys[i].push_back(node->id());
3027  node_row_vals[i].push_back(j->second);
3028 
3029  // If we're not sure whether our send
3030  // destination already has this node, let's give
3031  // it a copy.
3032  if (node->processor_id() != procdown)
3033  nodes_requested.insert(node);
3034 
3035  // We can have 0 nodal constraint
3036  // coefficients, where no Lagrange constrant
3037  // exists but non-Lagrange basis constraints
3038  // might.
3039  // libmesh_assert(j->second);
3040  }
3041  node_row_rhss[i] = _node_constraints[constrained_node].second;
3042  }
3043  }
3044 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3045 
3046  // Trade back the results
3047  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > dof_filled_keys,
3048  node_filled_keys;
3049  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > dof_filled_vals,
3050  node_filled_vals;
3051  std::vector<Number> dof_filled_rhss;
3052  std::vector<std::vector<Number> > adj_filled_rhss;
3053  std::vector<Point> node_filled_rhss;
3054  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, dof_row_keys,
3055  procup, dof_filled_keys);
3056  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, dof_row_vals,
3057  procup, dof_filled_vals);
3058  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, dof_row_rhss,
3059  procup, dof_filled_rhss);
3060  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, dof_adj_rhss,
3061  procup, adj_filled_rhss);
3062 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3063  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, node_row_keys,
3064  procup, node_filled_keys);
3065  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, node_row_vals,
3066  procup, node_filled_vals);
3067  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, node_row_rhss,
3068  procup, node_filled_rhss);
3069 
3070  // Constraining nodes might not even exist on our subset of
3071  // a distributed mesh, so let's make them exist.
3072  if (!mesh.is_serial())
3073  this->comm().send_receive_packed_range
3074  (procdown, &mesh, nodes_requested.begin(), nodes_requested.end(),
3075  procup, &mesh, mesh_inserter_iterator<Node>(mesh));
3076 
3077 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3078  libmesh_assert_equal_to (dof_filled_keys.size(), requested_dof_ids[procup].size());
3079  libmesh_assert_equal_to (dof_filled_vals.size(), requested_dof_ids[procup].size());
3080  libmesh_assert_equal_to (dof_filled_rhss.size(), requested_dof_ids[procup].size());
3081 #ifndef NDEBUG
3082  for (unsigned int q=0; q != adj_filled_rhss.size(); ++q)
3083  libmesh_assert_equal_to (adj_filled_rhss[q].size(), requested_dof_ids[procup].size());
3084 #endif
3085  libmesh_assert_equal_to (node_filled_keys.size(), requested_node_ids[procup].size());
3086  libmesh_assert_equal_to (node_filled_vals.size(), requested_node_ids[procup].size());
3087  libmesh_assert_equal_to (node_filled_rhss.size(), requested_node_ids[procup].size());
3088 
3089  // Add any new constraint rows we've found
3090  for (std::size_t i=0; i != requested_dof_ids[procup].size(); ++i)
3091  {
3092  libmesh_assert_equal_to (dof_filled_keys[i].size(), dof_filled_vals[i].size());
3093  if (!libmesh_isnan(dof_filled_rhss[i]))
3094  {
3095  dof_id_type constrained = requested_dof_ids[procup][i];
3096  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[constrained];
3097  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != dof_filled_keys[i].size(); ++j)
3098  row[dof_filled_keys[i][j]] = dof_filled_vals[i][j];
3099  if (dof_filled_rhss[i] != Number(0))
3100  _primal_constraint_values[constrained] = dof_filled_rhss[i];
3101  else
3102  _primal_constraint_values.erase(constrained);
3103 
3104  for (unsigned int q = 0; q != max_qoi_num; ++q)
3105  {
3106  AdjointDofConstraintValues::iterator adjoint_map_it =
3107  _adjoint_constraint_values.find(q);
3108 
3109  if ((adjoint_map_it == _adjoint_constraint_values.end()) &&
3110  adj_filled_rhss[q][constrained] == Number(0))
3111  continue;
3112 
3113  if (adjoint_map_it == _adjoint_constraint_values.end())
3114  adjoint_map_it = _adjoint_constraint_values.insert
3115  (std::make_pair(q,DofConstraintValueMap())).first;
3116 
3117  DofConstraintValueMap &constraint_map =
3118  adjoint_map_it->second;
3119 
3120  if (adj_filled_rhss[q][i] != Number(0))
3121  constraint_map[constrained] =
3122  adj_filled_rhss[q][i];
3123  else
3124  constraint_map.erase(constrained);
3125  }
3126 
3127  // And prepare to check for more recursive constraints
3128  if (!dof_filled_keys[i].empty())
3129  unexpanded_dofs.insert(constrained);
3130  }
3131  }
3132 
3133 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3134  for (std::size_t i=0; i != requested_node_ids[procup].size(); ++i)
3135  {
3136  libmesh_assert_equal_to (node_filled_keys[i].size(), node_filled_vals[i].size());
3137  if (!node_filled_keys[i].empty())
3138  {
3139  dof_id_type constrained_id = requested_node_ids[procup][i];
3140  const Node* constrained_node = mesh.node_ptr(constrained_id);
3141  NodeConstraintRow &row = _node_constraints[constrained_node].first;
3142  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != node_filled_keys[i].size(); ++j)
3143  {
3144  const Node* key_node =
3145  mesh.node_ptr(node_filled_keys[i][j]);
3146  libmesh_assert(key_node);
3147  row[key_node] = node_filled_vals[i][j];
3148  }
3149  _node_constraints[constrained_node].second = node_filled_rhss[i];
3150 
3151  // And prepare to check for more recursive constraints
3152  unexpanded_nodes.insert(constrained_node);
3153  }
3154  }
3155 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3156  }
3157 
3158  // We have to keep recursing while the unexpanded set is
3159  // nonempty on *any* processor
3160  unexpanded_set_nonempty = !unexpanded_dofs.empty() ||
3161  !unexpanded_nodes.empty();
3162  this->comm().max(unexpanded_set_nonempty);
3163  }
3164 }

void libMesh::DofMap::attach_extra_send_list_object ( DofMap::AugmentSendList &  asl)
inline

Attach an object to populate the send_list with extra entries. This should only add to the send list, but no checking is done to enforce this behavior.

This is an advanced function... use at your own peril!

void libMesh::DofMap::attach_extra_sparsity_function ( void(*)(SparsityPattern::Graph &sparsity, std::vector< dof_id_type > &n_nz, std::vector< dof_id_type > &n_oz, void *)  func,
void *  context = NULL 
)
inline

Attach a function pointer to use as a callback to populate the sparsity pattern with extra entries.

Care must be taken that when adding entries they are sorted into the Rows

Further, you must modify n_nz and n_oz properly!

This is an advanced function... use at your own peril!

void libMesh::DofMap::attach_extra_sparsity_object ( DofMap::AugmentSparsityPattern &  asp)
inline

Attach an object to use to populate the sparsity pattern with extra entries.

Care must be taken that when adding entries they are sorted into the Rows

Further, you must modify n_nz and n_oz properly!

This is an advanced function... use at your own peril!

void libMesh::DofMap::attach_matrix ( SparseMatrix< Number > &  matrix)

Additional matrices may be handled with this DofMap. They are initialized to the same sparsity structure as the major matrix.

Definition at line 230 of file dof_map.C.

References _matrices, _n_nz, _n_oz, _sp, libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::attach_dof_map(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::max(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::need_full_sparsity_pattern(), need_full_sparsity_pattern, and libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::update_sparsity_pattern().

Referenced by libMesh::EigenSystem::init_matrices(), and libMesh::ImplicitSystem::init_matrices().

231 {
232  parallel_object_only();
233 
234  // We shouldn't be trying to re-attach the same matrices repeatedly
235  libmesh_assert (std::find(_matrices.begin(), _matrices.end(),
236  &matrix) == _matrices.end());
237 
238  _matrices.push_back(&matrix);
239 
240  matrix.attach_dof_map (*this);
241 
242  // If we've already computed sparsity, then it's too late
243  // to wait for "compute_sparsity" to help with sparse matrix
244  // initialization, and we need to handle this matrix individually
245  bool computed_sparsity_already =
246  ((_n_nz && !_n_nz->empty()) ||
247  (_n_oz && !_n_oz->empty()));
248  this->comm().max(computed_sparsity_already);

253  // if we need it here

258  }

void libMesh::DofMap::build_constraint_matrix ( DenseMatrix< Number > &  C,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  elem_dofs,
const bool  called_recursively = false 
) const
private

Build the constraint matrix C associated with the element degree of freedom indices elem_dofs. The optional parameter called_recursively should be left at the default value false. This is used to handle the special case of an element's degrees of freedom being constrained in terms of other, local degrees of freedom. The usual case is for an elements DOFs to be constrained by some other, external DOFs.

2214 {
2215  if (!called_recursively) START_LOG("build_constraint_matrix()", "DofMap");
2216 
2217  // Create a set containing the DOFs we already depend on
2218  typedef std::set<dof_id_type> RCSet;
2219  RCSet dof_set;
2220 
2221  bool we_have_constraints = false;
2222 
2223  // Next insert any other dofs the current dofs might be constrained
2224  // in terms of. Note that in this case we may not be done: Those
2225  // may in turn depend on others. So, we need to repeat this process
2226  // in that case until the system depends only on unconstrained
2227  // degrees of freedom.
2228  for (unsigned int i=0; i<elem_dofs.size(); i++)

2260 
2261  // If we added any DOFS then we need to do this recursively.
2262  // It is possible that we just added a DOF that is also
2263  // constrained!
2264  //
2265  // Also, we need to handle the special case of an element having DOFs
2266  // constrained in terms of other, local DOFs
2267  if (!dof_set.empty() || // case 1: constrained in terms of other DOFs
2268  !called_recursively) // case 2: constrained in terms of our own DOFs
2269  {

2271  cast_int<unsigned int>(elem_dofs.size());

2275  dof_set.begin(), dof_set.end());

2293

2295  // libmesh_assert (!constraint_row.empty());

2298  it=constraint_row.begin(); it != constraint_row.end();

2303  }
2304  else
2305  {

2307  }
2308

libMesh::DofConstraintRow
std::map< dof_id_type, Real, std::less< dof_id_type >, Threads::scalable_allocator< std::pair< const dof_id_type, Real > > > DofConstraintRow
Definition: dof_map.h:86
libMesh::DenseMatrix< Number >
libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::DofMap::build_constraint_matrix_and_vector ( DenseMatrix< Number > &  C,
DenseVector< Number > &  H,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  elem_dofs,
int  qoi_index = -1,
const bool  called_recursively = false 
) const
private

Build the constraint matrix C and the forcing vector H associated with the element degree of freedom indices elem_dofs. The optional parameter called_recursively should be left at the default value false. This is used to handle the special case of an element's degrees of freedom being constrained in terms of other, local degrees of freedom. The usual case is for an elements DOFs to be constrained by some other, external DOFs and/or Dirichlet conditions.

The forcing vector will depend on which solution's heterogenous constraints are being applied. For the default qoi_index this will be the primal solutoin; for qoi_index >= 0 the corresponding adjoint solution's constraints will be used.

Definition at line 2329 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::DenseVector< T >::resize(), libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::resize(), libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::right_multiply(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), and libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::vector_mult_add().

2337

2339  typedef std::set<dof_id_type> RCSet;

2416  for (unsigned int i=0; i != old_size; i++)
2417  if (this->is_constrained_dof(elem_dofs[i]))

2441  if (rhsit != rhs_values->end())

2443  }
2444  }

2447  C(i,i) = 1.;
2448  }

2451  // that we just replaced a constrained DOF with another
2452  // constrained DOF.

2458

2460  (Cnew.n() == elem_dofs.size())) // is constrained...
2461  {
2462  // If x = Cy + h and y = Dz + g
2463  // Then x = (CD)z + (Cg + h)
2464  C.vector_mult_add(H, 1, Hnew);
2465 
2466  C.right_multiply(Cnew);
2467  }
2468

private

Builds a sparsity pattern

56 {
57  libmesh_assert (mesh.is_prepared());
58 
59  START_LOG("build_sparsity()", "DofMap");
60 
61  // Compute the sparsity structure of the global matrix. This can be
62  // fed into a PetscMatrix to allocate exacly the number of nonzeros
63  // necessary to store the matrix. This algorithm should be linear
64  // in the (# of elements)*(# nodes per element)
65 
66  // We can be more efficient in the threaded sparsity pattern assembly
67  // if we don't need the exact pattern. For some sparse matrix formats
68  // a good upper bound will suffice.
69 
70  // See if we need to include sparsity pattern entries for coupling
71  // between neighbor dofs
72  bool implicit_neighbor_dofs = this->use_coupled_neighbor_dofs(mesh);
73 
74  // We can compute the sparsity pattern in parallel on multiple
75  // threads. The goal is for each thread to compute the full sparsity
76  // pattern for a subset of elements. These sparsity patterns can
77  // be efficiently merged in the SparsityPattern::Build::join()
78  // method, especially if there is not too much overlap between them.
79  // Even better, if the full sparsity pattern is not needed then
80  // the number of nonzeros per row can be estimated from the
81  // sparsity patterns created on each thread.
82  UniquePtr<SparsityPattern::Build> sp
83  (new SparsityPattern::Build (mesh,
84  *this,
85  this->_dof_coupling,
86  implicit_neighbor_dofs,
87  need_full_sparsity_pattern));
88 
89  Threads::parallel_reduce (ConstElemRange (mesh.active_local_elements_begin(),
90  mesh.active_local_elements_end()), *sp);
91 
92  sp->parallel_sync();
93 
94 #ifndef NDEBUG
95  // Avoid declaring these variables unless asserts are enabled.
96  const processor_id_type proc_id = mesh.processor_id();
97  const dof_id_type n_dofs_on_proc = this->n_dofs_on_processor(proc_id);
98 #endif
99  libmesh_assert_equal_to (sp->sparsity_pattern.size(), n_dofs_on_proc);
100 
101  STOP_LOG("build_sparsity()", "DofMap");
102 
103  // Check to see if we have any extra stuff to add to the sparsity_pattern
104  if (_extra_sparsity_function)
105  {
106  if (_augment_sparsity_pattern)
107  {
108  libmesh_here();
109  libMesh::out << "WARNING: You have specified both an extra sparsity function and object.\n"
110  << " Are you sure this is what you meant to do??"
111  << std::endl;
112  }
113 
114  _extra_sparsity_function
115  (sp->sparsity_pattern, sp->n_nz,
116  sp->n_oz, _extra_sparsity_context);
117  }
118 
119  if (_augment_sparsity_pattern)
120  _augment_sparsity_pattern->augment_sparsity_pattern
121  (sp->sparsity_pattern, sp->n_nz, sp->n_oz);
122 
123  return UniquePtr<SparsityPattern::Build>(sp.release());
124 }

void libMesh::DofMap::compute_sparsity ( const MeshBase &  mesh)

Computes the sparsity pattern for the matrices corresponding to proc_id and sends that data to Linear Algebra packages for preallocation of sparse matrices.

Definition at line 1661 of file dof_map.C.

References _matrices, _n_nz, _n_oz, _sp, build_sparsity(), end, and need_full_sparsity_pattern.

Referenced by libMesh::EigenSystem::init_matrices(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::init_matrices(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::reinit(), and libMesh::EigenSystem::reinit().

1662 {
1663  _sp = this->build_sparsity(mesh);
1664 
1665  // It is possible that some \p SparseMatrix implementations want to
1666  // see it. Let them see it before we throw it away.
1667  std::vector<SparseMatrix<Number>* >::const_iterator
1668  pos = _matrices.begin(),
1669  end = _matrices.end();
1670 
1671  // If we need the full sparsity pattern, then we share a view of its
1672  // arrays, and we pass it in to the matrices.
1673  if (need_full_sparsity_pattern)
1674  {
1675  _n_nz = &_sp->n_nz;
1676  _n_oz = &_sp->n_oz;
1677 
1678  for (; pos != end; ++pos)
1679  (*pos)->update_sparsity_pattern (_sp->sparsity_pattern);
1680  }
1681  // If we don't need the full sparsity pattern anymore, steal the
1682  // arrays we do need and free the rest of the memory
1683  else
1684  {

1686  _n_nz = new std::vector<dof_id_type>();
1687  _n_nz->swap(_sp->n_nz);
1688  if (!_n_oz)
1689  _n_oz = new std::vector<dof_id_type>();
1690  _n_oz->swap(_sp->n_oz);
1691 
1692  _sp.reset();
1693  }

void libMesh::DofMap::constrain_element_dyad_matrix ( DenseVector< Number > &  v,
DenseVector< Number > &  w,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  row_dofs,
bool  asymmetric_constraint_rows = true 
) const
inline

Constrains a dyadic element matrix B = v w'. This method requires the element matrix to be square, in which case the elem_dofs correspond to the global DOF indices of both the rows and columns of the element matrix. For this case the rows and columns of the matrix necessarily correspond to variables of the same approximation order.

Definition at line 1855 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::DenseVector< T >::size(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), and libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::vector_mult_transpose().

1859 {
1860  libmesh_assert_equal_to (v.size(), row_dofs.size());
1861  libmesh_assert_equal_to (w.size(), row_dofs.size());
1862 
1863  // check for easy return
1864  if (this->_dof_constraints.empty())
1865  return;
1866 
1867  // The constrained RHS is built up as R^T F.
1868  DenseMatrix<Number> R;
1869 
1870  this->build_constraint_matrix (R, row_dofs);
1871 
1872  START_LOG("cnstrn_elem_dyad_mat()", "DofMap");
1873 
1874  // It is possible that the vector is not constrained at all.
1875  if ((R.m() == v.size()) &&
1876  (R.n() == row_dofs.size())) // if the RHS is constrained
1877  {
1878  // Compute the matrix-vector products
1879  DenseVector<Number> old_v(v);
1880  DenseVector<Number> old_w(w);
1881 
1882  // compute matrix/vector product
1883  R.vector_mult_transpose(v, old_v);
1884  R.vector_mult_transpose(w, old_w);
1885 
1886  libmesh_assert_equal_to (row_dofs.size(), v.size());
1887  libmesh_assert_equal_to (row_dofs.size(), w.size());
1888 
1889  /* Constrain only v, not w. */
1890 
1891  for (unsigned int i=0; i<row_dofs.size(); i++)
1892  if (this->is_constrained_dof(row_dofs[i]))
1893  {
1894  // If the DOF is constrained
1895  libmesh_assert (_dof_constraints.find(row_dofs[i]) != _dof_constraints.end());
1896 
1897  v(i) = 0;
1898  }
1899  } // end if the RHS is constrained.
1900 
1901  STOP_LOG("cnstrn_elem_dyad_mat()", "DofMap");
1902 }

libMesh::DofMap::build_constraint_matrix
void build_constraint_matrix(DenseMatrix< Number > &C, std::vector< dof_id_type > &elem_dofs, const bool called_recursively=false) const
Definition: dof_map_constraints.C:2211
libMesh::DenseVector< Number >
libMesh::DenseMatrix< Number >
libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::DofMap::constrain_element_matrix ( DenseMatrix< Number > &  matrix,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  elem_dofs,
bool  asymmetric_constraint_rows = true 
) const
inline

Constrains the element matrix. This method requires the element matrix to be square, in which case the elem_dofs correspond to the global DOF indices of both the rows and columns of the element matrix. For this case the rows and columns of the matrix necessarily correspond to variables of the same approximation order.

If asymmetric_constraint_rows is set to true (as it is by default), constraint row equations will be reinforced in a way which breaks matrix symmetry but makes inexact linear solver solutions more likely to satisfy hanging node constraints.

Definition at line 1389 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::left_multiply_transpose(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::right_multiply(), libMesh::START_LOG(), and libMesh::STOP_LOG().

1392 {
1393  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), matrix.m());
1394  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), matrix.n());
1395 
1396  // check for easy return
1397  if (this->_dof_constraints.empty())
1398  return;
1399 
1400  // The constrained matrix is built up as C^T K C.
1401  DenseMatrix<Number> C;
1402 
1403 
1404  this->build_constraint_matrix (C, elem_dofs);
1405 
1406  START_LOG("constrain_elem_matrix()", "DofMap");
1407 
1408  // It is possible that the matrix is not constrained at all.
1409  if ((C.m() == matrix.m()) &&
1410  (C.n() == elem_dofs.size())) // It the matrix is constrained
1411  {
1412  // Compute the matrix-matrix-matrix product C^T K C
1413  matrix.left_multiply_transpose (C);
1414  matrix.right_multiply (C);
1415 
1416 
1417  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.m(), matrix.n());
1418  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.m(), elem_dofs.size());
1419  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.n(), elem_dofs.size());
1420 
1421 
1422  for (unsigned int i=0; i<elem_dofs.size(); i++)
1423  // If the DOF is constrained
1424  if (this->is_constrained_dof(elem_dofs[i]))
1425  {
1426  for (unsigned int j=0; j<matrix.n(); j++)
1427  matrix(i,j) = 0.;
1428 
1429  matrix(i,i) = 1.;
1430 
1431  if (asymmetric_constraint_rows)
1432  {
1433  DofConstraints::const_iterator
1434  pos = _dof_constraints.find(elem_dofs[i]);
1435 
1436  libmesh_assert (pos != _dof_constraints.end());
1437 
1438  const DofConstraintRow& constraint_row = pos->second;
1439 
1440  // This is an overzealous assertion in the presence of
1441  // heterogenous constraints: we now can constrain "u_i = c"
1442  // with no other u_j terms involved.
1443  //
1444  // libmesh_assert (!constraint_row.empty());
1445 
1446  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
1447  it=constraint_row.begin(); it != constraint_row.end();
1448  ++it)
1449  for (unsigned int j=0; j<elem_dofs.size(); j++)
1450  if (elem_dofs[j] == it->first)
1451  matrix(i,j) = -it->second;
1452  }
1453  }
1454  } // end if is constrained...
1455 
1456  STOP_LOG("constrain_elem_matrix()", "DofMap");
1457 }

libMesh::DofConstraintRow
std::map< dof_id_type, Real, std::less< dof_id_type >, Threads::scalable_allocator< std::pair< const dof_id_type, Real > > > DofConstraintRow
Definition: dof_map.h:86
libMesh::DenseMatrix< Number >
libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::DofMap::constrain_element_matrix ( DenseMatrix< Number > &  matrix,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  row_dofs,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  col_dofs,
bool  asymmetric_constraint_rows = true 
) const
inline

Constrains the element matrix. This method allows the element matrix to be non-square, in which case the row_dofs and col_dofs may be of different size and correspond to variables approximated in different spaces.

Definition at line 1730 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::left_multiply_transpose(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::right_multiply(), libMesh::START_LOG(), and libMesh::STOP_LOG().

1734 {
1735  libmesh_assert_equal_to (row_dofs.size(), matrix.m());
1736  libmesh_assert_equal_to (col_dofs.size(), matrix.n());
1737 
1738  // check for easy return
1739  if (this->_dof_constraints.empty())
1740  return;
1741 
1742  // The constrained matrix is built up as R^T K C.
1743  DenseMatrix<Number> R;
1744  DenseMatrix<Number> C;
1745 
1746  // Safeguard against the user passing us the same
1747  // object for row_dofs and col_dofs. If that is done
1748  // the calls to build_matrix would fail
1749  std::vector<dof_id_type> orig_row_dofs(row_dofs);
1750  std::vector<dof_id_type> orig_col_dofs(col_dofs);
1751 
1752  this->build_constraint_matrix (R, orig_row_dofs);
1753  this->build_constraint_matrix (C, orig_col_dofs);
1754 
1755  START_LOG("constrain_elem_matrix()", "DofMap");
1756 
1757  row_dofs = orig_row_dofs;
1758  col_dofs = orig_col_dofs;
1759 
1760 
1761  // It is possible that the matrix is not constrained at all.
1762  if ((R.m() == matrix.m()) &&
1763  (R.n() == row_dofs.size()) &&
1764  (C.m() == matrix.n()) &&
1765  (C.n() == col_dofs.size())) // If the matrix is constrained
1766  {
1767  // K_constrained = R^T K C
1768  matrix.left_multiply_transpose (R);
1769  matrix.right_multiply (C);
1770 
1771 
1772  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.m(), row_dofs.size());
1773  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.n(), col_dofs.size());
1774 
1775 
1776  for (unsigned int i=0; i<row_dofs.size(); i++)
1777  if (this->is_constrained_dof(row_dofs[i]))
1778  {
1779  for (unsigned int j=0; j<matrix.n(); j++)
1780  {
1781  if(row_dofs[i] != col_dofs[j])
1782  matrix(i,j) = 0.;
1783  else // If the DOF is constrained
1784  matrix(i,j) = 1.;
1785  }
1786 
1787  if (asymmetric_constraint_rows)
1788  {
1789  DofConstraints::const_iterator
1790  pos = _dof_constraints.find(row_dofs[i]);
1791 
1792  libmesh_assert (pos != _dof_constraints.end());
1793 
1794  const DofConstraintRow& constraint_row = pos->second;
1795 
1796  libmesh_assert (!constraint_row.empty());
1797 
1798  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
1799  it=constraint_row.begin(); it != constraint_row.end();
1800  ++it)
1801  for (unsigned int j=0; j<col_dofs.size(); j++)
1802  if (col_dofs[j] == it->first)
1803  matrix(i,j) = -it->second;
1804  }
1805  }
1806  } // end if is constrained...
1807 
1808  STOP_LOG("constrain_elem_matrix()", "DofMap");
1809 }

Definition: dense_matrix.C:85
libMesh::DofConstraintRow
std::map< dof_id_type, Real, std::less< dof_id_type >, Threads::scalable_allocator< std::pair< const dof_id_type, Real > > > DofConstraintRow
Definition: dof_map.h:86
libMesh::DenseMatrix< Number >
libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::DofMap::constrain_element_matrix_and_vector ( DenseMatrix< Number > &  matrix,
DenseVector< Number > &  rhs,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  elem_dofs,
bool  asymmetric_constraint_rows = true 
) const
inline

Constrains the element matrix and vector. This method requires the element matrix to be square, in which case the elem_dofs correspond to the global DOF indices of both the rows and columns of the element matrix. For this case the rows and columns of the matrix necessarily correspond to variables of the same approximation order.

Definition at line 1461 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::left_multiply_transpose(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::right_multiply(), libMesh::DenseVector< T >::size(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), and libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::vector_mult_transpose().

1465 {
1466  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), matrix.m());
1467  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), matrix.n());
1468  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), rhs.size());
1469 
1470  // check for easy return
1471  if (this->_dof_constraints.empty())
1472  return;
1473 
1474  // The constrained matrix is built up as C^T K C.
1475  // The constrained RHS is built up as C^T F
1476  DenseMatrix<Number> C;
1477 
1478  this->build_constraint_matrix (C, elem_dofs);
1479 
1480  START_LOG("cnstrn_elem_mat_vec()", "DofMap");
1481 
1482  // It is possible that the matrix is not constrained at all.
1483  if ((C.m() == matrix.m()) &&
1484  (C.n() == elem_dofs.size())) // It the matrix is constrained
1485  {
1486  // Compute the matrix-matrix-matrix product C^T K C
1487  matrix.left_multiply_transpose (C);
1488  matrix.right_multiply (C);
1489 
1490 
1491  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.m(), matrix.n());
1492  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.m(), elem_dofs.size());
1493  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.n(), elem_dofs.size());
1494 
1495 
1496  for (unsigned int i=0; i<elem_dofs.size(); i++)
1497  if (this->is_constrained_dof(elem_dofs[i]))
1498  {
1499  for (unsigned int j=0; j<matrix.n(); j++)
1500  matrix(i,j) = 0.;
1501 
1502  // If the DOF is constrained
1503  matrix(i,i) = 1.;
1504 
1505  // This will put a nonsymmetric entry in the constraint
1506  // row to ensure that the linear system produces the
1507  // correct value for the constrained DOF.
1508  if (asymmetric_constraint_rows)
1509  {
1510  DofConstraints::const_iterator
1511  pos = _dof_constraints.find(elem_dofs[i]);
1512 
1513  libmesh_assert (pos != _dof_constraints.end());
1514 
1515  const DofConstraintRow& constraint_row = pos->second;
1516 
1517  // p refinement creates empty constraint rows
1518  // libmesh_assert (!constraint_row.empty());
1519 
1520  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
1521  it=constraint_row.begin(); it != constraint_row.end();
1522  ++it)
1523  for (unsigned int j=0; j<elem_dofs.size(); j++)
1524  if (elem_dofs[j] == it->first)
1525  matrix(i,j) = -it->second;
1526  }
1527  }
1528 
1529 
1530  // Compute the matrix-vector product C^T F
1531  DenseVector<Number> old_rhs(rhs);
1532 
1533  // compute matrix/vector product
1534  C.vector_mult_transpose(rhs, old_rhs);
1535  } // end if is constrained...
1536 
1537  STOP_LOG("cnstrn_elem_mat_vec()", "DofMap");
1538 }

1821  return;

1824  DenseMatrix<Number> R;

1827

1829

1831  if ((R.m() == rhs.size()) &&
1832  (R.n() == row_dofs.size())) // if the RHS is constrained
1833  {

1835  DenseVector<Number> old_rhs(rhs);

1837

1844  libmesh_assert (_dof_constraints.find(row_dofs[i]) != _dof_constraints.end());
1845 
1846  rhs(i) = 0;
1847  }
1848  } // end if the RHS is constrained.

void libMesh::DofMap::constrain_nothing ( std::vector< dof_id_type > &  dofs) const

Does not actually constrain anything, but modifies dofs in the same way as any of the constrain functions would do, i.e. adds those dofs in terms of which any of the existing dofs is constrained.

const Elem *  elem,
unsigned int  s,
unsigned int  p 
)

Constrains degrees of freedom on side s of element elem which correspond to variable number var and to p refinement levels above p.

3737 {
3738  // We're constraining dofs on elem which correspond to p refinement
3739  // levels above p - this only makes sense if elem's p refinement
3740  // level is above p.
3741  libmesh_assert_greater (elem->p_level(), p);
3742  libmesh_assert_less (s, elem->n_sides());
3743 
3744  const unsigned int sys_num = this->sys_number();
3745  const unsigned int dim = elem->dim();
3746  ElemType type = elem->type();
3747  FEType low_p_fe_type = this->variable_type(var);
3748  FEType high_p_fe_type = this->variable_type(var);
3749  low_p_fe_type.order = static_cast<Order>(low_p_fe_type.order + p);
3750  high_p_fe_type.order = static_cast<Order>(high_p_fe_type.order +
3751  elem->p_level());
3752

3755  if (elem->is_node_on_side(n, s))
3756  {

3758  const unsigned int low_nc =
3759  FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node (dim, low_p_fe_type, type, n);
3760  const unsigned int high_nc =
3761  FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node (dim, high_p_fe_type, type, n);
3762 
3763  // since we may be running this method concurrently
3764  // on multiple threads we need to acquire a lock
3765  // before modifying the _dof_constraints object.
3766  Threads::spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(Threads::spin_mtx);
3767

3769  {
3770  // Add "this is zero" constraint rows for high p vertex
3771  // dofs
3772  for (unsigned int i = low_nc; i != high_nc; ++i)
3773  {
3774  _dof_constraints[node->dof_number(sys_num,var,i)].clear();
3775  _primal_constraint_values.erase(node->dof_number(sys_num,var,i));
3776  }
3777  }
3778  else
3779  {
3780  const unsigned int total_dofs = node->n_comp(sys_num, var);
3781  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (total_dofs, high_nc);
3782  // Add "this is zero" constraint rows for high p
3783  // non-vertex dofs, which are numbered in reverse
3784  for (unsigned int j = low_nc; j != high_nc; ++j)
3785  {
3786  const unsigned int i = total_dofs - j - 1;
3787  _dof_constraints[node->dof_number(sys_num,var,i)].clear();
3788  _primal_constraint_values.erase(node->dof_number(sys_num,var,i));
3789  }

3791  }

void libMesh::DofMap::create_dof_constraints ( const MeshBase &  mesh,
Real  time = 0 
)

Rebuilds the raw degree of freedom and DofObject constraints. A time is specified for use in building time-dependent Dirichlet constraints.

Definition at line 1044 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

1046  parallel_object_only();

1048  START_LOG("create_dof_constraints()", "DofMap");
1049 
1050  libmesh_assert (mesh.is_prepared());
1051

1053  // or from boundary conditions in any dimension
1054  const bool possible_local_constraints = false

1064 #endif

1066

1072  this->comm().max(possible_global_constraints);
1073 #endif
1074

1076  {
1077  // Clear out any old constraints; maybe the user just deleted
1078  // their last remaining dirichlet/periodic/user constraint?
1079 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
1080  _dof_constraints.clear();
1081  _stashed_dof_constraints.clear();
1082  _primal_constraint_values.clear();
1083  _adjoint_constraint_values.clear();
1084 #endif
1085 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
1086  _node_constraints.clear();
1087 #endif
1088 
1089  // make sure we stop logging though
1090  STOP_LOG("create_dof_constraints()", "DofMap");
1091  return;
1092  }
1093 
1094  // Here we build the hanging node constraints. This is done
1095  // by enforcing the condition u_a = u_b along hanging sides.
1096  // u_a = u_b is collocated at the nodes of side a, which gives
1097  // one row of the constraint matrix.
1098 
1099  // Processors only compute their local constraints
1100  ConstElemRange range (mesh.local_elements_begin(),
1101  mesh.local_elements_end());
1102 
1103  // Global computation fails if we're using a FEMFunctionBase BC on a
1104  // SerialMesh in parallel
1105  // ConstElemRange range (mesh.elements_begin(),
1106  // mesh.elements_end());
1107 
1108  // compute_periodic_constraints requires a point_locator() from our
1109  // Mesh, but point_locator() construction is parallel and threaded.
1110  // Rather than nest threads within threads we'll make sure it's
1111  // preconstructed.
1112 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_PERIODIC
1113  bool need_point_locator = !_periodic_boundaries->empty() && !range.empty();
1114 
1115  this->comm().max(need_point_locator);
1116 
1117  if (need_point_locator)
1118  mesh.sub_point_locator();
1119 #endif
1120 
1121 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
1122  // recalculate node constraints from scratch
1123  _node_constraints.clear();
1124 
1125  Threads::parallel_for (range,
1126  ComputeNodeConstraints (_node_constraints,
1127  *this,
1128 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_PERIODIC
1129  *_periodic_boundaries,
1130 #endif
1131  mesh));
1132 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
1133 
1134 
1135  // recalculate dof constraints from scratch
1136  _dof_constraints.clear();
1137  _stashed_dof_constraints.clear();
1138  _primal_constraint_values.clear();
1139  _adjoint_constraint_values.clear();
1140 
1141  // Look at all the variables in the system. Reset the element
1142  // range at each iteration -- there is no need to reconstruct it.
1143  for (unsigned int variable_number=0; variable_number<this->n_variables();
1144  ++variable_number, range.reset())
1145  Threads::parallel_for (range,
1146  ComputeConstraints (_dof_constraints,
1147  *this,
1148 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_PERIODIC
1149  *_periodic_boundaries,
1150 #endif
1151  mesh,
1152  variable_number));
1153 
1154 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_DIRICHLET
1155  for (DirichletBoundaries::iterator
1156  i = _dirichlet_boundaries->begin();
1157  i != _dirichlet_boundaries->end(); ++i, range.reset())
1158  {
1159  Threads::parallel_for
1160  (range,
1161  ConstrainDirichlet(*this, mesh, time, **i,
1162  AddPrimalConstraint(*this))
1163  );
1164  }
1165 
1166  for (unsigned int qoi_index = 0;
1167  qoi_index != _adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries.size();
1168  ++qoi_index)
1169  {
1170  for (DirichletBoundaries::iterator
1171  i = _adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries[qoi_index]->begin();
1172  i != _adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries[qoi_index]->end();
1173  ++i, range.reset())
1174  {
1175  Threads::parallel_for
1176  (range,
1177  ConstrainDirichlet(*this, mesh, time, **i,
1178  AddAdjointConstraint(*this, qoi_index))
1179  );
1180  }
1181  }
1182 
1183 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_DIRICHLET

1186 }

void libMesh::DofMap::distribute_dofs ( MeshBase &  mesh)

Distrubute dofs on the current mesh. Also builds the send list for processor proc_id, which defaults to 0 for ease of use in serial applications.

Definition at line 845 of file dof_map.C.

References _end_df, _end_old_df, _first_df, _first_old_df, _first_old_scalar_df, _first_scalar_df, _n_dfs, _n_old_dfs, _send_list, add_neighbors_to_send_list(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::allgather(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), distribute_local_dofs_node_major(), distribute_local_dofs_var_major(), libMesh::DofObject::dof_number(), elem_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_end(), end_dof(), libMesh::FEType::family, first_dof(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, invalidate_dofs(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_prepared(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_dof_ids(), mesh, libMesh::DofObject::n_comp(), n_dofs(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), n_SCALAR_dofs(), n_variables(), libMesh::DofObject::n_vars(), node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_end(), libMesh::on_command_line(), libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), reinit(), libMesh::SCALAR, set_nonlocal_dof_objects(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), sys_number(), libMesh::Variable::type(), and variable().
