846 {
847  // This function must be run on all processors at once
848  parallel_object_only();
849 
850  // Log how long it takes to distribute the degrees of freedom
851  START_LOG("distribute_dofs()", "DofMap");
852 
853  libmesh_assert (mesh.is_prepared());
854 
855  const processor_id_type proc_id = this->processor_id();
856  const processor_id_type n_proc = this->n_processors();
857 
858  // libmesh_assert_greater (this->n_variables(), 0);
859  libmesh_assert_less (proc_id, n_proc);
860 
861  // re-init in case the mesh has changed
862  this->reinit(mesh);
863 
864  // By default distribute variables in a
865  // var-major fashion, but allow run-time
866  // specification
867  bool node_major_dofs = libMesh::on_command_line ("--node_major_dofs");
868 
869  // The DOF counter, will be incremented as we encounter
870  // new degrees of freedom
871  dof_id_type next_free_dof = 0;
872 
873  // Clear the send list before we rebuild it
874  _send_list.clear();
875 
876  // Set temporary DOF indices on this processor
877  if (node_major_dofs)
878  this->distribute_local_dofs_node_major (next_free_dof, mesh);
879  else
880  this->distribute_local_dofs_var_major (next_free_dof, mesh);
881 
882  // Get DOF counts on all processors
883  std::vector<dof_id_type> dofs_on_proc(n_proc, 0);
884  this->comm().allgather(next_free_dof, dofs_on_proc);
885 
886  // Resize and fill the _first_df and _end_df arrays
887 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
888  _first_old_df = _first_df;
889  _end_old_df = _end_df;
890 #endif
891 
892  _first_df.resize(n_proc);
893  _end_df.resize (n_proc);
894 
895  // Get DOF offsets
896  _first_df[0] = 0;
897  for (processor_id_type i=1; i < n_proc; ++i)
898  _first_df[i] = _end_df[i-1] = _first_df[i-1] + dofs_on_proc[i-1];
899  _end_df[n_proc-1] = _first_df[n_proc-1] + dofs_on_proc[n_proc-1];
900 
901  // Clear all the current DOF indices
902  // (distribute_dofs expects them cleared!)
903  this->invalidate_dofs(mesh);
904 
905  next_free_dof = _first_df[proc_id];
906 
907  // Set permanent DOF indices on this processor
908  if (node_major_dofs)
909  this->distribute_local_dofs_node_major (next_free_dof, mesh);
910  else
911  this->distribute_local_dofs_var_major (next_free_dof, mesh);
912 
913  libmesh_assert_equal_to (next_free_dof, _end_df[proc_id]);
914 
915  //------------------------------------------------------------
916  // At this point, all n_comp and dof_number values on local
917  // DofObjects should be correct, but a ParallelMesh might have
918  // incorrect values on non-local DofObjects. Let's request the
919  // correct values from each other processor.
920 
921  if (this->n_processors() > 1)
922  {
923  this->set_nonlocal_dof_objects(mesh.nodes_begin(),
924  mesh.nodes_end(),
925  mesh, &DofMap::node_ptr);
926 
927  this->set_nonlocal_dof_objects(mesh.elements_begin(),
928  mesh.elements_end(),
929  mesh, &DofMap::elem_ptr);
930  }
931 
932 #ifdef DEBUG
933  {
934  const unsigned int
935  sys_num = this->sys_number();
936 
937  // Processors should all agree on DoF ids
938  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_dof_ids(mesh);
939 
940  // DoF processor ids should match DofObject processor ids
941  MeshBase::const_node_iterator node_it = mesh.nodes_begin();
942  const MeshBase::const_node_iterator node_end = mesh.nodes_end();
943  for ( ; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
944  {
945  DofObject const * const dofobj = *node_it;
946  const processor_id_type obj_proc_id = dofobj->processor_id();
947 
948  for (unsigned int v=0; v != dofobj->n_vars(sys_num); ++v)
949  for (unsigned int c=0; c != dofobj->n_comp(sys_num,v); ++c)
950  {
951  const dof_id_type dofid = dofobj->dof_number(sys_num,v,c);
952  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (dofid, this->first_dof(obj_proc_id));
953  libmesh_assert_less (dofid, this->end_dof(obj_proc_id));
954  }
955  }
956 
957  MeshBase::const_element_iterator elem_it = mesh.elements_begin();
958  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator elem_end = mesh.elements_end();
959  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
960  {
961  DofObject const * const dofobj = *elem_it;
962  const processor_id_type obj_proc_id = dofobj->processor_id();
963 
964  for (unsigned int v=0; v != dofobj->n_vars(sys_num); ++v)
965  for (unsigned int c=0; c != dofobj->n_comp(sys_num,v); ++c)
966  {
967  const dof_id_type dofid = dofobj->dof_number(sys_num,v,c);
968  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (dofid, this->first_dof(obj_proc_id));
969  libmesh_assert_less (dofid, this->end_dof(obj_proc_id));
970  }
971  }
972  }
973 #endif
974 
975  // Set the total number of degrees of freedom, then start finding
976  // SCALAR degrees of freedom
977 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
978  _n_old_dfs = _n_dfs;
979  _first_old_scalar_df = _first_scalar_df;
980 #endif
981  _n_dfs = _end_df[n_proc-1];
982  _first_scalar_df.clear();
983  _first_scalar_df.resize(this->n_variables(), DofObject::invalid_id);
984  dof_id_type current_SCALAR_dof_index = n_dofs() - n_SCALAR_dofs();
985 
986  // Calculate and cache the initial DoF indices for SCALAR variables.
987  // This is an O(N_vars) calculation so we want to do it once per
988  // renumbering rather than once per SCALAR_dof_indices() call
989 
990  for (unsigned int v=0; v<this->n_variables(); v++)
991  if(this->variable(v).type().family == SCALAR)
992  {
993  _first_scalar_df[v] = current_SCALAR_dof_index;
994  current_SCALAR_dof_index += this->variable(v).type().order;
995  }
996 
997  STOP_LOG("distribute_dofs()", "DofMap");
998 
999  // Note that in the add_neighbors_to_send_list nodes on processor
1000  // boundaries that are shared by multiple elements are added for
1001  // each element.
1002  this->add_neighbors_to_send_list(mesh);

1005  // EquationSystems call that for us, after we've added constraint

libMesh::DofMap::_n_dfs
dof_id_type _n_dfs
Definition: dof_map.h:1340
libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::DofMap::distribute_local_dofs_node_major ( dof_id_type &  next_free_dof,
MeshBase &  mesh 
)
private

Distributes the global degrees of freedom, for dofs on this processor. In this format all the degrees of freedom at a node/element are in contiguous blocks. Note in particular that the degrees of freedom for a given variable are not in contiguous blocks, as in the case of distribute_local_dofs_var_major. Starts at index next_free_dof, and increments it to the post-final index. If build_send_list is true, builds the send list. If false, clears and reserves the send list

Definition at line 1100 of file dof_map.C.

References _n_SCALAR_dofs, libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_end(), libMesh::Variable::active_on_subdomain(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::Elem::get_node(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_procids< Node >(), libMesh::MeshBase::local_nodes_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::local_nodes_end(), mesh, libMesh::DofObject::n_comp(), libMesh::DofObject::n_comp_group(), n_nodes, libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::DofObject::n_var_groups(), n_variable_groups(), libMesh::VariableGroup::n_variables(), libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::DofObject::set_vg_dof_base(), libMesh::Elem::subdomain_id(), sys_number(), libMesh::Variable::type(), variable_group(), and libMesh::DofObject::vg_dof_base().

Referenced by distribute_dofs().

1102 {
1103  const unsigned int sys_num = this->sys_number();
1104  const unsigned int n_var_groups = this->n_variable_groups();

1107  // First count and assign temporary numbers to local dofs

1111  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
1112  {

1114  // elements on this processor.
1115  Elem* elem = *elem_it;
1116  const unsigned int n_nodes = elem->n_nodes();

1125  const VariableGroup &vg_description(this->variable_group(vg));

1129  {

1131  // our node and if they aren't already there
1132  if ((node->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg) > 0) &&
1133  (node->processor_id() == this->processor_id()) &&
1134  (node->vg_dof_base(sys_num,vg) ==
1135  DofObject::invalid_id))
1136  {
1137  node->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num,
1138  vg,
1139  next_free_dof);
1140  next_free_dof += (vg_description.n_variables()*

1143  }
1144  }
1145  }
1146  }
1147 
1148  // Now number the element DOFS
1149  for (unsigned vg=0; vg<n_var_groups; vg++)

1151  const VariableGroup &vg_description(this->variable_group(vg));
1152

1154  (vg_description.active_on_subdomain(elem->subdomain_id())) )
1155  if (elem->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg) > 0)
1156  {
1157  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem->vg_dof_base(sys_num,vg),
1158  DofObject::invalid_id);
1159 
1160  elem->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num,
1161  vg,
1162  next_free_dof);
1163 
1164  next_free_dof += (vg_description.n_variables()*
1165  elem->n_comp(sys_num,vg));
1166  }
1167  }
1168  } // done looping over elements
1169 
1170 
1171  // we may have missed assigning DOFs to nodes that we own
1172  // but to which we have no connected elements matching our
1173  // variable restriction criterion. this will happen, for example,
1174  // if variable V is restricted to subdomain S. We may not own
1175  // any elements which live in S, but we may own nodes which are
1176  // *connected* to elements which do. in this scenario these nodes
1177  // will presently have unnumbered DOFs. we need to take care of
1178  // them here since we own them and no other processor will touch them.
1179  {
1180  MeshBase::node_iterator node_it = mesh.local_nodes_begin();
1181  const MeshBase::node_iterator node_end = mesh.local_nodes_end();
1182 
1183  for (; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
1184  {
1185  Node *node = *node_it;
1186  libmesh_assert(node);
1187 
1188  for (unsigned vg=0; vg<n_var_groups; vg++)
1189  {
1190  const VariableGroup &vg_description(this->variable_group(vg));
1191 
1192  if (node->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg))
1193  if (node->vg_dof_base(sys_num,vg) == DofObject::invalid_id)
1194  {
1195  node->set_vg_dof_base (sys_num,
1196  vg,
1197  next_free_dof);
1198 
1199  next_free_dof += (vg_description.n_variables()*
1200  node->n_comp(sys_num,vg));
1201  }
1202  }
1203  }
1204  }
1205 
1206  // Finally, count up the SCALAR dofs
1207  this->_n_SCALAR_dofs = 0;
1208  for (unsigned vg=0; vg<n_var_groups; vg++)
1209  {
1210  const VariableGroup &vg_description(this->variable_group(vg));
1211 
1212  if( vg_description.type().family == SCALAR )
1213  {
1214  this->_n_SCALAR_dofs += (vg_description.n_variables()*
1215  vg_description.type().order);
1216  continue;
1217  }
1218  }
1219 
1220  // Only increment next_free_dof if we're on the processor
1221  // that holds this SCALAR variable
1222  if ( this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1) )
1223  next_free_dof += _n_SCALAR_dofs;
1224 
1225 #ifdef DEBUG
1226  {
1227  // libMesh::out << "next_free_dof=" << next_free_dof << std::endl
1228  // << "_n_SCALAR_dofs=" << _n_SCALAR_dofs << std::endl;
1229 
1230  // Make sure we didn't miss any nodes
1231  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_procids<Node>(mesh);
1232 
1233  MeshBase::node_iterator node_it = mesh.local_nodes_begin();
1234  const MeshBase::node_iterator node_end = mesh.local_nodes_end();
1235  for (; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
1236  {
1237  Node *obj = *node_it;
1238  libmesh_assert(obj);
1239  unsigned int n_var_g = obj->n_var_groups(this->sys_number());
1240  for (unsigned int vg=0; vg != n_var_g; ++vg)
1241  {
1242  unsigned int n_comp_g =
1243  obj->n_comp_group(this->sys_number(), vg);
1244  dof_id_type my_first_dof = n_comp_g ?
1245  obj->vg_dof_base(this->sys_number(), vg) : 0;
1246  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (my_first_dof, DofObject::invalid_id);
1247  }
1248  }
1249  }

void libMesh::DofMap::distribute_local_dofs_var_major ( dof_id_type &  next_free_dof,
MeshBase &  mesh 
)
private

Distributes the global degrees of freedom, for dofs on this processor. In this format the local degrees of freedom are in a contiguous block for each variable in the system. Starts at index next_free_dof, and increments it to the post-final index.

Definition at line 1255 of file dof_map.C.

References _n_SCALAR_dofs, libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_end(), libMesh::Variable::active_on_subdomain(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::Elem::get_node(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_procids< Node >(), libMesh::MeshBase::local_nodes_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::local_nodes_end(), mesh, libMesh::DofObject::n_comp_group(), n_nodes, libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::DofObject::n_var_groups(), n_variable_groups(), libMesh::VariableGroup::n_variables(), libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::DofObject::set_vg_dof_base(), libMesh::Elem::subdomain_id(), sys_number(), libMesh::Variable::type(), variable_group(), and libMesh::DofObject::vg_dof_base().

1257 {
1258  const unsigned int sys_num = this->sys_number();
1259  const unsigned int n_var_groups = this->n_variable_groups();
1260 
1261  //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
1262  // First count and assign temporary numbers to local dofs
1263  for (unsigned vg=0; vg<n_var_groups; vg++)
1264  {
1265  const VariableGroup &vg_description(this->variable_group(vg));
1266 
1267  const unsigned int n_vars_in_group = vg_description.n_variables();
1268 
1269  // Skip the SCALAR dofs
1270  if (vg_description.type().family == SCALAR)
1271  continue;
1272 
1273  MeshBase::element_iterator elem_it = mesh.active_local_elements_begin();
1274  const MeshBase::element_iterator elem_end = mesh.active_local_elements_end();
1275 
1276  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
1277  {
1278  // Only number dofs connected to active
1279  // elements on this processor.
1280  Elem* elem = *elem_it;
1281 
1282  // ... and only variables which are active on
1283  // on this element's subdomain
1284  if (!vg_description.active_on_subdomain(elem->subdomain_id()))
1285  continue;
1286 
1287  const unsigned int n_nodes = elem->n_nodes();
1288 
1289  // First number the nodal DOFS
1290  for (unsigned int n=0; n<n_nodes; n++)
1291  {
1292  Node* node = elem->get_node(n);
1293 
1294  // assign dof numbers (all at once) if this is
1295  // our node and if they aren't already there
1296  if ((node->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg) > 0) &&
1297  (node->processor_id() == this->processor_id()) &&
1298  (node->vg_dof_base(sys_num,vg) ==
1299  DofObject::invalid_id))
1300  {
1301  node->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num,
1302  vg,
1303  next_free_dof);
1304 
1305  next_free_dof += (n_vars_in_group*
1306  node->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg));
1307  }
1308  }
1309 
1310  // Now number the element DOFS
1311  if (elem->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg) > 0)
1312  {
1313  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem->vg_dof_base(sys_num,vg),
1314  DofObject::invalid_id);
1315 
1316  elem->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num,
1317  vg,
1318  next_free_dof);
1319 
1320  next_free_dof += (n_vars_in_group*
1321  elem->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg));
1322  }
1323  } // end loop on elements
1324 
1325  // we may have missed assigning DOFs to nodes that we own
1326  // but to which we have no connected elements matching our
1327  // variable restriction criterion. this will happen, for example,
1328  // if variable V is restricted to subdomain S. We may not own
1329  // any elements which live in S, but we may own nodes which are
1330  // *connected* to elements which do. in this scenario these nodes
1331  // will presently have unnumbered DOFs. we need to take care of
1332  // them here since we own them and no other processor will touch them.
1333  {
1334  MeshBase::node_iterator node_it = mesh.local_nodes_begin();
1335  const MeshBase::node_iterator node_end = mesh.local_nodes_end();
1336 
1337  for (; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
1338  {
1339  Node *node = *node_it;
1340  libmesh_assert(node);
1341 
1342  if (node->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg))
1343  if (node->vg_dof_base(sys_num,vg) == DofObject::invalid_id)
1344  {
1345  node->set_vg_dof_base (sys_num,
1346  vg,
1347  next_free_dof);
1348 
1349  next_free_dof += (n_vars_in_group*
1350  node->n_comp_group(sys_num,vg));
1351  }
1352  }
1353  }
1354  } // end loop on variable groups
1355 
1356  // Finally, count up the SCALAR dofs
1357  this->_n_SCALAR_dofs = 0;
1358  for (unsigned vg=0; vg<n_var_groups; vg++)
1359  {
1360  const VariableGroup &vg_description(this->variable_group(vg));
1361 
1362  if( vg_description.type().family == SCALAR )
1363  {
1364  this->_n_SCALAR_dofs += (vg_description.n_variables()*
1365  vg_description.type().order);
1366  continue;
1367  }
1368  }
1369 
1370  // Only increment next_free_dof if we're on the processor
1371  // that holds this SCALAR variable
1372  if ( this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1) )
1373  next_free_dof += _n_SCALAR_dofs;
1374

1376  {
1377  // Make sure we didn't miss any nodes
1378  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_procids<Node>(mesh);
1379 
1380  MeshBase::node_iterator node_it = mesh.local_nodes_begin();
1381  const MeshBase::node_iterator node_end = mesh.local_nodes_end();
1382  for (; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
1383  {
1384  Node *obj = *node_it;

2045  v_global = v_built.get();
2046 
2047  v_local = &v;
2048  libmesh_assert (v_local->closed());
2049  }
2050  else if (v.type() == PARALLEL)
2051  {
2052  v_built = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
2053  v_built->init (v.size(), v.size(), true, SERIAL);
2054  v.localize(*v_built);
2055  v_built->close();
2056  v_local = v_built.get();
2057 
2058  v_global = &v;
2059  }
2060  else if (v.type() == GHOSTED)
2061  {
2062  v_local = &v;
2063  v_global = &v;
2064  }
2065  else // unknown v.type()
2066  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: Unknown v.type() == " << v.type());
2067 
2068  // We should never hit these asserts because we should error-out in
2069  // else clause above. Just to be sure we don't try to use v_local
2070  // and v_global uninitialized...
2071  libmesh_assert(v_local);
2072  libmesh_assert(v_global);
2073 
2074  // Do we have any non_homogeneous constraints?
2075  const AdjointDofConstraintValues::const_iterator
2076  adjoint_constraint_map_it = _adjoint_constraint_values.find(q);
2077  const DofConstraintValueMap *constraint_map =
2078  (adjoint_constraint_map_it == _adjoint_constraint_values.end()) ?
2079  NULL : &adjoint_constraint_map_it->second;
2080 
2081  DofConstraints::const_iterator c_it = _dof_constraints.begin();
2082  const DofConstraints::const_iterator c_end = _dof_constraints.end();
2083 
2084  for ( ; c_it != c_end; ++c_it)
2085  {
2086  dof_id_type constrained_dof = c_it->first;
2087  if (constrained_dof < this->first_dof() ||
2088  constrained_dof >= this->end_dof())
2089  continue;
2090 
2091  const DofConstraintRow constraint_row = c_it->second;
2092 
2093  Number exact_value = 0;
2094  if (constraint_map)
2095  {
2096  const DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator
2097  adjoint_constraint_it =
2098  constraint_map->find(constrained_dof);
2099  if (adjoint_constraint_it != constraint_map->end())
2100  exact_value = adjoint_constraint_it->second;
2101  }
2102 
2103  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
2104  j=constraint_row.begin(); j != constraint_row.end();
2105  ++j)
2106  exact_value += j->second * (*v_local)(j->first);
2107 
2108  v_global->set(constrained_dof, exact_value);
2109  }
2110 
2111  // If the old vector was serial, we probably need to send our values
2112  // to other processors
2113  if (v.type() == SERIAL)
2114  {
2115 #ifndef NDEBUG
2116  v_global->close();
2117 #endif
2118  v_global->localize (v);
2119  }
2120  v.close();
2121 
2122  STOP_LOG("enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly()","DofMap");
2123 }

libMesh::dof_id_type
uint8_t dof_id_type

libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
libMesh::NumericVector::localize
virtual void localize(std::vector< T > &v_local) const =0
void libMesh::DofMap::enforce_constraints_exactly ( const System &  system,
NumericVector< Number > *  v = NULL,
bool  homogeneous = false 
) const
inline

Constrains the numeric vector v, which represents a solution defined on the mesh. This may need to be used after a linear solve, if your linear solver's solutions do not satisfy your DoF constraints to a tight enough tolerance.

If v == NULL, the system solution vector is constrained

If homogeneous == true, heterogeneous constraints are enforced as if they were homogeneous. This might be appropriate for e.g. a vector representing a difference between two heterogeneously-constrained solutions.

Definition at line 1920 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::closed(), libMesh::comm, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::get(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::GHOSTED, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::localize(), libMesh::PARALLEL, libMesh::SERIAL, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::set(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::size(), libMesh::System::solution, libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), and libMesh::NumericVector< T >::type().

Referenced by libMesh::__libmesh_petsc_diff_solver_residual(), libMesh::__libmesh_petsc_snes_jacobian(), libMesh::__libmesh_petsc_snes_postcheck(), libMesh::__libmesh_petsc_snes_residual(), libMesh::Problem_Interface::computeF(), libMesh::Problem_Interface::computeJacobian(), libMesh::Problem_Interface::computePreconditioner(), DMlibMeshFunction(), DMlibMeshJacobian(), libMesh::AdjointRefinementEstimator::estimate_error(), libMesh::System::project_vector(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve(), libMesh::NewtonSolver::solve(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solve(), and libMesh::ImplicitSystem::weighted_sensitivity_solve().

1923 {
1924  parallel_object_only();
1925 
1926  if (!this->n_constrained_dofs())
1927  return;
1928 
1929  START_LOG("enforce_constraints_exactly()","DofMap");
1930 
1931  if (!v)
1932  v = system.solution.get();
1933 
1934  NumericVector<Number> *v_local = NULL; // will be initialized below
1935  NumericVector<Number> *v_global = NULL; // will be initialized below
1936  UniquePtr<NumericVector<Number> > v_built;
1937  if (v->type() == SERIAL)
1938  {
1939  v_built = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
1940  v_built->init(this->n_dofs(), this->n_local_dofs(), true, PARALLEL);
1941  v_built->close();
1942 
1943  for (dof_id_type i=v_built->first_local_index();
1944  i<v_built->last_local_index(); i++)
1945  v_built->set(i, (*v)(i));
1946  v_built->close();
1947  v_global = v_built.get();
1948 
1949  v_local = v;
1950  libmesh_assert (v_local->closed());
1951  }
1952  else if (v->type() == PARALLEL)
1953  {
1954  v_built = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
1955  v_built->init (v->size(), v->size(), true, SERIAL);
1956  v->localize(*v_built);
1957  v_built->close();
1958  v_local = v_built.get();
1959 
1960  v_global = v;
1961  }
1962  else if (v->type() == GHOSTED)
1963  {
1964  v_local = v;
1965  v_global = v;
1966  }
1967  else // unknown v->type()
1968  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: Unknown v->type() == " << v->type());
1969 
1970  // We should never hit these asserts because we should error-out in
1971  // else clause above. Just to be sure we don't try to use v_local
1972  // and v_global uninitialized...
1973  libmesh_assert(v_local);
1974  libmesh_assert(v_global);
1975  libmesh_assert_equal_to (this, &(system.get_dof_map()));
1976

1978  const DofConstraints::const_iterator c_end = _dof_constraints.end();
1979 
1980  for ( ; c_it != c_end; ++c_it)
1981  {
1982  dof_id_type constrained_dof = c_it->first;
1983  if (constrained_dof < this->first_dof() ||
1984  constrained_dof >= this->end_dof())
1985  continue;
1986 
1987  const DofConstraintRow constraint_row = c_it->second;
1988 
1989  Number exact_value = 0;
1990  if (!homogeneous)
1991  {
1992  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
1993  _primal_constraint_values.find(constrained_dof);
1994  if (rhsit != _primal_constraint_values.end())
1995  exact_value = rhsit->second;
1996  }
1997  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
1998  j=constraint_row.begin(); j != constraint_row.end();
1999  ++j)
2000  exact_value += j->second * (*v_local)(j->first);
2001 
2002  v_global->set(constrained_dof, exact_value);
2003  }
2004 
2005  // If the old vector was serial, we probably need to send our values
2006  // to other processors
2007  if (v->type() == SERIAL)
2008  {
2009 #ifndef NDEBUG
2010  v_global->close();
2011 #endif
2012  v_global->localize (*v);
2013  }
2014  v->close();
2015 
2016  STOP_LOG("enforce_constraints_exactly()","DofMap");
2017 }

libMesh::NumericVector::localize
virtual void localize(std::vector< T > &v_local) const =0
void libMesh::DofMap::extract_local_vector ( const NumericVector< Number > &  Ug,
const std::vector< dof_id_type > &  dof_indices,
DenseVectorBase< Number > &  Ue 
) const

Builds the local element vector Ue from the global vector Ug, accounting for any constrained degrees of freedom. For an element without constrained degrees of freedom this is the trivial mapping

Note that the user must ensure that the element vector Ue is properly sized when calling this method. This is because there is no resize() method in the DenseVectorBase<> class.

Definition at line 1719 of file dof_map.C.

References build_constraint_matrix_and_vector(), libMesh::DenseVectorBase< T >::el(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::first_local_index(), is_constrained_dof(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::last_local_index(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::DenseVectorBase< T >::size(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::size(), and libMesh::DenseVectorBase< T >::zero().

1722 {
1723 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
1724 
1725  // Trivial mapping
1726  libmesh_assert_equal_to (dof_indices_in.size(), Ue.size());
1727  bool has_constrained_dofs = false;
1728 
1729  for (unsigned int il=0;
1730  il != cast_int<unsigned int>(dof_indices_in.size()); il++)
1731  {
1732  const dof_id_type ig = dof_indices_in[il];
1733 
1734  if (this->is_constrained_dof (ig)) has_constrained_dofs = true;
1735 
1736  libmesh_assert_less (ig, Ug.size());
1737 
1738  Ue.el(il) = Ug(ig);
1739  }
1740 
1741  // If the element has any constrained DOFs then we need
1742  // to account for them in the mapping. This will handle
1743  // the case that the input vector is not constrained.
1744  if (has_constrained_dofs)
1745  {
1746  // Copy the input DOF indices.
1747  std::vector<dof_id_type> constrained_dof_indices(dof_indices_in);

1751

1753 
1754  libmesh_assert_equal_to (dof_indices_in.size(), C.m());
1755  libmesh_assert_equal_to (constrained_dof_indices.size(), C.n());
1756 
1757  // zero-out Ue
1758  Ue.zero();
1759

1761  const unsigned int n_original_dofs =
1762  cast_int<unsigned int>(dof_indices_in.size());

1764  {
1765  Ue.el(i) = H(i);
1766

1774  // overzealous. If Ug is a parallel vector, then this assert
1775  // is redundant.
1776  // libmesh_assert ((jg >= Ug.first_local_index()) &&
1777  // (jg < Ug.last_local_index()));
1778 
1779  Ue.el(i) += C(i,j)*Ug(jg);
1780  }
1781  }
1782  }
1783 
1784 #else
1785 
1786  // Trivial mapping
1787 
1788  const unsigned int n_original_dofs =
1789  cast_int<unsigned int>(dof_indices_in.size());
1790 
1791  libmesh_assert_equal_to (n_original_dofs, Ue.size());
1792

1796 
1797  libmesh_assert ((ig >= Ug.first_local_index()) && (ig < Ug.last_local_index()));
1798

private

Finds all the DofObjects associated with the set in objs. This will account for off-element couplings via hanging nodes.

void libMesh::DofMap::find_connected_dofs ( std::vector< dof_id_type > &  elem_dofs) const
private

Finds all the DOFS associated with the element DOFs elem_dofs. This will account for off-element couplings via hanging nodes.

Definition at line 2375 of file dof_map.C.

References _dof_constraints, is_constrained_dof(), and libMesh::libmesh_assert().

Referenced by libMesh::SparsityPattern::Build::operator()().

2376 {
2377  typedef std::set<dof_id_type> RCSet;
2378 
2379  // First insert the DOFS we already depend on into the set.
2380  RCSet dof_set (elem_dofs.begin(), elem_dofs.end());
2381 
2382  bool done = true;
2383 
2384  // Next insert any dofs those might be constrained in terms
2385  // of. Note that in this case we may not be done: Those may
2386  // in turn depend on others. So, we need to repeat this process
2387  // in that case until the system depends only on unconstrained
2388  // degrees of freedom.
2389  for (unsigned int i=0; i<elem_dofs.size(); i++)
2390  if (this->is_constrained_dof(elem_dofs[i]))
2391  {
2392  // If the DOF is constrained
2393  DofConstraints::const_iterator
2394  pos = _dof_constraints.find(elem_dofs[i]);
2395 
2396  libmesh_assert (pos != _dof_constraints.end());
2397 
2398  const DofConstraintRow& constraint_row = pos->second;
2399 
2400  // adaptive p refinement currently gives us lots of empty constraint
2401  // rows - we should optimize those DoFs away in the future. [RHS]
2402  //libmesh_assert (!constraint_row.empty());
2403 
2404  DofConstraintRow::const_iterator it = constraint_row.begin();
2405  DofConstraintRow::const_iterator it_end = constraint_row.end();
2406 
2407 
2408  // Add the DOFs this dof is constrained in terms of.
2409  // note that these dofs might also be constrained, so
2410  // we will need to call this function recursively.
2411  for ( ; it != it_end; ++it)
2412  if (!dof_set.count (it->first))
2413  {
2414  dof_set.insert (it->first);
2415  done = false;
2416  }
2417  }
2418 
2419 
2420  // If not done then we need to do more work
2421  // (obviously :-) )!
2422  if (!done)
2423  {
2424  // Fill the vector with the contents of the set
2425  elem_dofs.clear();
2426  elem_dofs.insert (elem_dofs.end(),
2427  dof_set.begin(), dof_set.end());
2428 
2429 
2430  // May need to do this recursively. It is possible
2431  // that we just replaced a constrained DOF with another
2432  // constrained DOF.
2433  this->find_connected_dofs (elem_dofs);
2434 
2435  } // end if (!done)
2436 }

const std::vector<dof_id_type>& libMesh::DofMap::get_n_nz ( ) const
inline

Returns a constant reference to the _n_nz list for this processor. The vector contains the bandwidth of the on-processor coupling for each row of the global matrix that the current processor owns. This information can be used to preallocate space for a parallel sparse matrix.

const std::vector<dof_id_type>& libMesh::DofMap::get_send_list ( ) const
inline

Returns a constant reference to the _send_list for this processor. The _send_list contains the global indices of all the variables in the global solution vector that influence the current processor. This information can be used for gathers at each solution step to retrieve solution values needed for computation.

DenseVector< Number > &  rhs,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  elem_dofs,
bool  asymmetric_constraint_rows = true,
int  qoi_index = -1 
) const

Constrains the element matrix and vector. This method requires the element matrix to be square, in which case the elem_dofs correspond to the global DOF indices of both the rows and columns of the element matrix. For this case the rows and columns of the matrix necessarily correspond to variables of the same approximation order.

The heterogenous version of this method creates linear systems in which heterogenously constrained degrees of freedom will solve to their correct offset values, as would be appropriate for finding a solution to a linear problem in a single algebraic solve. The non-heterogenous version of this method creates linear systems in which even heterogenously constrained degrees of freedom are solved without offset values taken into account, as would be appropriate for finding linearized updates to a solution in which heterogenous constraints are already satisfied.

By default, the constraints for the primal solution of this system are used. If a non-negative qoi_index is passed in, then the constraints for the corresponding adjoint solution are used instead.

Definition at line 1543 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References dof_id, libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::left_multiply_transpose(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::right_multiply(), libMesh::DenseVector< T >::size(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::vector_mult(), and libMesh::DenseMatrix< T >::vector_mult_transpose().

1548 {
1549  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), matrix.m());
1550  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), matrix.n());
1551  libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_dofs.size(), rhs.size());
1552 
1553  // check for easy return
1554  if (this->_dof_constraints.empty())
1555  return;
1556 
1557  // The constrained matrix is built up as C^T K C.
1558  // The constrained RHS is built up as C^T (F - K H)
1559  DenseMatrix<Number> C;
1560  DenseVector<Number> H;
1561 
1562  this->build_constraint_matrix_and_vector (C, H, elem_dofs, qoi_index);
1563 
1564  START_LOG("hetero_cnstrn_elem_mat_vec()", "DofMap");
1565 
1566  // It is possible that the matrix is not constrained at all.
1567  if ((C.m() == matrix.m()) &&
1568  (C.n() == elem_dofs.size())) // It the matrix is constrained
1569  {
1570  // We may have rhs values to use later
1571  const DofConstraintValueMap *rhs_values = NULL;
1572  if (qoi_index < 0)
1573  rhs_values = &_primal_constraint_values;
1574  else
1575  {
1576  const AdjointDofConstraintValues::const_iterator
1577  it = _adjoint_constraint_values.find(qoi_index);
1578  if (it != _adjoint_constraint_values.end())
1579  rhs_values = &it->second;
1580  }
1581 
1582  // Compute matrix/vector product K H
1583  DenseVector<Number> KH;
1584  matrix.vector_mult(KH, H);
1585 
1586  // Compute the matrix-vector product C^T (F - KH)
1587  DenseVector<Number> F_minus_KH(rhs);
1588  F_minus_KH -= KH;
1589  C.vector_mult_transpose(rhs, F_minus_KH);
1590 
1591  // Compute the matrix-matrix-matrix product C^T K C
1592  matrix.left_multiply_transpose (C);
1593  matrix.right_multiply (C);
1594 
1595  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.m(), matrix.n());
1596  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.m(), elem_dofs.size());
1597  libmesh_assert_equal_to (matrix.n(), elem_dofs.size());
1598 
1599  for (unsigned int i=0; i<elem_dofs.size(); i++)
1600  {
1601  const dof_id_type dof_id = elem_dofs[i];
1602 
1603  if (this->is_constrained_dof(dof_id))
1604  {
1605  for (unsigned int j=0; j<matrix.n(); j++)
1606  matrix(i,j) = 0.;
1607 
1608  // If the DOF is constrained
1609  matrix(i,i) = 1.;
1610 
1611  // This will put a nonsymmetric entry in the constraint
1612  // row to ensure that the linear system produces the
1613  // correct value for the constrained DOF.
1614  if (asymmetric_constraint_rows)
1615  {
1616  DofConstraints::const_iterator
1617  pos = _dof_constraints.find(dof_id);
1618 
1619  libmesh_assert (pos != _dof_constraints.end());
1620 
1621  const DofConstraintRow& constraint_row = pos->second;
1622 
1623  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
1624  it=constraint_row.begin(); it != constraint_row.end();
1625  ++it)
1626  for (unsigned int j=0; j<elem_dofs.size(); j++)
1627  if (elem_dofs[j] == it->first)
1628  matrix(i,j) = -it->second;
1629 
1630  if (rhs_values)
1631  {
1632  const DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator valpos =
1633  rhs_values->find(dof_id);
1634 
1635  rhs(i) = (valpos == rhs_values->end()) ?
1636  0 : valpos->second;
1637  }
1638  }
1639  else
1640  rhs(i) = 0.;
1641  }
1642  }
1643 
1644  } // end if is constrained...
1645 
1646  STOP_LOG("hetero_cnstrn_elem_mat_vec()", "DofMap");
1647 }

Definition: id_types.h:64
libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::DofMap::heterogenously_constrain_element_vector ( const DenseMatrix< Number > &  matrix,
DenseVector< Number > &  rhs,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  elem_dofs,
bool  asymmetric_constraint_rows = true,
int  qoi_index = -1 
) const

Constrains the element vector. This method requires the element matrix to be square and not-yet-constrained, in which case the elem_dofs correspond to the global DOF indices of both the rows and columns of the element matrix.

The heterogenous version of this method creates linear systems in which heterogenously constrained degrees of freedom will solve to their correct offset values, as would be appropriate for finding a solution to a linear problem in a single algebraic solve. The non-heterogenous version of this method creates linear systems in which even heterogenously constrained degrees of freedom are solved without offset values taken into account, as would be appropriate for finding linearized updates to a solution in which heterogenous constraints are already satisfied.

By default, the constraints for the primal solution of this system are used. If a non-negative qoi_index is passed in, then the constraints for the corresponding adjoint solution are used instead.

dof_id_type libMesh::DofMap::last_dof ( const processor_id_type  proc) const
inline

Returns the last dof index that is local to processor proc. This function is now deprecated, because it returns nonsense in the rare case where proc has no local dof indices. Use end_dof() instead.

Fills an array of those dof indices which belong to the given variable number and live on the current processor.

1022  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator elem_end = mesh.active_local_elements_end();
1023

1025  {
1026  // Only count dofs connected to active
1027  // elements on this processor.
1028  Elem* elem = *elem_it;
1029  const unsigned int n_nodes = elem->n_nodes();
1030 
1031  // First get any new nodal DOFS
1032  for (unsigned int n=0; n<n_nodes; n++)
1033  {
1034  Node* node = elem->get_node(n);
1035 
1036  if (node->processor_id() < this->processor_id())
1037  continue;
1038

1040  for(unsigned int i=0; i<n_comp; i++)
1041  {
1042  const dof_id_type index = node->dof_number(sys_num,var_num,i);
1043  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (index, this->first_dof());
1044  libmesh_assert_less (index, this->end_dof());
1045 
1046  if (idx.empty() || index > idx.back())
1047  idx.push_back(index);
1048  }
1049  }
1050 
1051  // Next get any new element DOFS
1052  const unsigned int n_comp = elem->n_comp(sys_num, var_num);
1053  for(unsigned int i=0; i<n_comp; i++)
1054  {
1055  const dof_id_type index = elem->dof_number(sys_num,var_num,i);
1056  if (idx.empty() || index > idx.back())
1057  idx.push_back(index);
1058  }
1059  } // done looping over elements
1060 
1061 
1062  // we may have missed assigning DOFs to nodes that we own
1063  // but to which we have no connected elements matching our
1064  // variable restriction criterion. this will happen, for example,
1065  // if variable V is restricted to subdomain S. We may not own
1066  // any elements which live in S, but we may own nodes which are
1067  // *connected* to elements which do. in this scenario these nodes
1068  // will presently have unnumbered DOFs. we need to take care of
1069  // them here since we own them and no other processor will touch them.
1070  {
1071  MeshBase::const_node_iterator node_it = mesh.local_nodes_begin();
1072  const MeshBase::const_node_iterator node_end = mesh.local_nodes_end();
1073 
1074  for (; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
1075  {
1076  Node *node = *node_it;
1077  libmesh_assert(node);
1078 
1079  const unsigned int n_comp = node->n_comp(sys_num, var_num);
1080  for(unsigned int i=0; i<n_comp; i++)
1081  {
1082  const dof_id_type index = node->dof_number(sys_num,var_num,i);
1083  if (idx.empty() || index > idx.back())
1084  idx.push_back(index);
1085  }
1086  }
1087  }
1088  }
1089  // Otherwise, count up the SCALAR dofs, if we're on the processor
1090  // that holds this SCALAR variable
1091  else if ( this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1) )
1092  {
1093  std::vector<dof_id_type> di_scalar;
1094  this->SCALAR_dof_indices(di_scalar,var_num);
1095  idx.insert( idx.end(), di_scalar.begin(), di_scalar.end());
1096  }
1097 }
libMesh::libmesh_assert

libMesh::DofMap::variable_type
const FEType & variable_type(const unsigned int c) const
Definition: dof_map.h:1477

std::pair< Real, Real > libMesh::DofMap::max_constraint_error ( const System &  system,
NumericVector< Number > *  v = NULL 
) const

Tests the constrained degrees of freedom on the numeric vector v, which represents a solution defined on the mesh, returning a pair whose first entry is the maximum absolute error on a constrained DoF and whose second entry is the maximum relative error. Useful for debugging purposes.

If v == NULL, the system solution vector is tested.

Definition at line 2128 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References std::abs(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_end(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::closed(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::first_local_index(), libMesh::for(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::last_local_index(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::m(), std::max(), libMesh::DenseMatrixBase< T >::n(), libMesh::Real, and libMesh::System::solution.

2130 {
2131  if (!v)
2132  v = system.solution.get();
2133  NumericVector<Number> &vec = *v;
2134 
2135  // We'll assume the vector is closed
2136  libmesh_assert (vec.closed());
2137 
2138  Real max_absolute_error = 0., max_relative_error = 0.;
2139 
2140  const MeshBase &mesh = system.get_mesh();
2141 
2142  libmesh_assert_equal_to (this, &(system.get_dof_map()));
2143 
2144  // indices on each element
2145  std::vector<dof_id_type> local_dof_indices;
2146 
2147  MeshBase::const_element_iterator elem_it =
2148  mesh.active_local_elements_begin();
2149  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator elem_end =
2150  mesh.active_local_elements_end();
2151 
2152  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
2153  {
2154  const Elem* elem = *elem_it;
2155 
2156  this->dof_indices(elem, local_dof_indices);
2157  std::vector<dof_id_type> raw_dof_indices = local_dof_indices;
2158 
2159  // Constraint matrix for each element
2160  DenseMatrix<Number> C;
2161 
2162  this->build_constraint_matrix (C, local_dof_indices);
2163 
2164  // Continue if the element is unconstrained
2165  if (!C.m())
2166  continue;
2167 
2168  libmesh_assert_equal_to (C.m(), raw_dof_indices.size());
2169  libmesh_assert_equal_to (C.n(), local_dof_indices.size());
2170 
2171  for (unsigned int i=0; i!=C.m(); ++i)
2172  {
2173  // Recalculate any constrained dof owned by this processor
2174  dof_id_type global_dof = raw_dof_indices[i];
2175  if (this->is_constrained_dof(global_dof) &&
2176  global_dof >= vec.first_local_index() &&
2177  global_dof < vec.last_local_index())
2178  {
2179  DofConstraints::const_iterator
2180  pos = _dof_constraints.find(global_dof);
2181 
2182  libmesh_assert (pos != _dof_constraints.end());
2183 
2184  Number exact_value = 0;
2185  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
2186  _primal_constraint_values.find(global_dof);
2187  if (rhsit != _primal_constraint_values.end())
2188  exact_value = rhsit->second;
2189 
2190  for (unsigned int j=0; j!=C.n(); ++j)
2191  {
2192  if (local_dof_indices[j] != global_dof)
2193  exact_value += C(i,j) *
2194  vec(local_dof_indices[j]);
2195  }
2196 
2197  max_absolute_error = std::max(max_absolute_error,
2198  std::abs(vec(global_dof) - exact_value));
2199  max_relative_error = std::max(max_relative_error,
2200  std::abs(vec(global_dof) - exact_value)
2201  / std::abs(exact_value));
2202  }
2203  }
2204  }
2205 
2206  return std::pair<Real, Real>(max_absolute_error, max_relative_error);
2207 }

mesh
MeshBase & mesh
Definition: mesh_communication.C:920
void libMesh::DofMap::old_dof_indices ( const Elem *const  elem,
std::vector< dof_id_type > &  di,
const unsigned int  vn = libMesh::invalid_uint 
) const

After a mesh is refined and repartitioned it is possible that the _send_list will need to be augmented. This is the case when an element is refined and its children end up on different processors than the parent. These children will need values from the parent when projecting the solution onto the refined mesh, hence the parent's DOF indices need to be included in the _send_list. Fills the vector di with the global degree of freedom indices for the element using the DofMap::old_dof_object. If no variable number is specified then all variables are returned.

Definition at line 2146 of file dof_map.C.

References libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Variable::active_on_subdomain(), libMesh::dim, libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::DofObject::dof_number(), libMesh::FEInterface::extra_hanging_dofs(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::MeshTools::Subdivision::find_one_ring(), libMesh::Elem::get_node(), libMesh::DofObject::has_dofs(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::invalid_uint, libMesh::Elem::is_vertex(), libMesh::Elem::JUST_COARSENED, libMesh::Elem::JUST_REFINED, libMesh::LAGRANGE, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::libmesh_assert_greater(), libMesh::DofObject::n_comp(), libMesh::FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node(), libMesh::FEInterface::n_dofs_per_elem(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::DofObject::n_systems(), n_variables(), libMesh::n_vars, libMesh::DofObject::old_dof_object, libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::Elem::p_level(), libMesh::Elem::p_refinement_flag(), libMesh::Elem::refinement_flag(), libMesh::SCALAR, SCALAR_dof_indices(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::Elem::subdomain_id(), sys_number(), libMesh::TRI3SUBDIVISION, libMesh::Elem::type(), variable(), and variable_type().

Referenced by libMesh::FEGenericBase< OutputType >::coarsened_dof_values(), and libMesh::FEMContext::pre_fe_reinit().

2149 {
2150  START_LOG("old_dof_indices()", "DofMap");
2151 
2152  libmesh_assert(elem);
2153 
2154  const ElemType type = elem->type();
2155  const unsigned int sys_num = this->sys_number();
2156  const unsigned int n_vars = this->n_variables();
2157  const unsigned int dim = elem->dim();
2158 
2159  // If we have dof indices stored on the elem, and there's no chance
2160  // that we only have those indices because we were just p refined,
2161  // then we should have old dof indices too.
2162  libmesh_assert(!elem->has_dofs(sys_num) ||
2163  elem->p_refinement_flag() == Elem::JUST_REFINED ||
2164  elem->old_dof_object);
2165 
2166  // Clear the DOF indices vector.
2167  di.clear();
2168 
2169  // Determine the nodes contributing to element elem
2170  std::vector<Node*> elem_nodes;
2171  if (elem->type() == TRI3SUBDIVISION)
2172  {
2173  // Subdivision surface FE require the 1-ring around elem
2174  const Tri3Subdivision* sd_elem = static_cast<const Tri3Subdivision*>(elem);
2175  MeshTools::Subdivision::find_one_ring(sd_elem, elem_nodes);
2176  }
2177  else
2178  {
2179  // All other FE use only the nodes of elem itself
2180  elem_nodes.resize(elem->n_nodes(), NULL);
2181  for (unsigned int i=0; i<elem->n_nodes(); i++)
2182  elem_nodes[i] = elem->get_node(i);
2183  }
2184 
2185  // Get the dof numbers
2186  for (unsigned int v=0; v<n_vars; v++)
2187  if ((v == vn) || (vn == libMesh::invalid_uint))
2188  {
2189  if(this->variable(v).type().family == SCALAR &&
2190  (!elem ||
2191  this->variable(v).active_on_subdomain(elem->subdomain_id())))
2192  {
2193  // We asked for this variable, so add it to the vector.
2194  std::vector<dof_id_type> di_new;
2195  this->SCALAR_dof_indices(di_new,v,true);
2196  di.insert( di.end(), di_new.begin(), di_new.end());
2197  }
2198  else
2199  if (this->variable(v).active_on_subdomain(elem->subdomain_id()))
2200  { // Do this for all the variables if one was not specified
2201  // or just for the specified variable
2202 
2203  // Increase the polynomial order on p refined elements,
2204  // but make sure you get the right polynomial order for
2205  // the OLD degrees of freedom
2206  int p_adjustment = 0;
2207  if (elem->p_refinement_flag() == Elem::JUST_REFINED)
2208  {
2209  libmesh_assert_greater (elem->p_level(), 0);
2210  p_adjustment = -1;
2211  }
2212  else if (elem->p_refinement_flag() == Elem::JUST_COARSENED)
2213  {
2214  p_adjustment = 1;
2215  }
2216  FEType fe_type = this->variable_type(v);
2217  fe_type.order = static_cast<Order>(fe_type.order +
2218  elem->p_level() +
2219  p_adjustment);
2220 
2221  const bool extra_hanging_dofs =
2222  FEInterface::extra_hanging_dofs(fe_type);
2223 
2224  // Get the node-based DOF numbers
2225  for (unsigned int n=0; n<elem_nodes.size(); n++)
2226  {
2227  const Node* node = elem_nodes[n];
2228 
2229  // There is a potential problem with h refinement. Imagine a
2230  // quad9 that has a linear FE on it. Then, on the hanging side,
2231  // it can falsely identify a DOF at the mid-edge node. This is why
2232  // we call FEInterface instead of node->n_comp() directly.
2233  const unsigned int nc = FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node (dim,
2234  fe_type,
2235  type,
2236  n);
2237  libmesh_assert(node->old_dof_object);
2238 
2239  // If this is a non-vertex on a hanging node with extra
2240  // degrees of freedom, we use the non-vertex dofs (which
2241  // come in reverse order starting from the end, to
2242  // simplify p refinement)
2243  if (extra_hanging_dofs && !elem->is_vertex(n))
2244  {
2245  const int dof_offset =
2246  node->old_dof_object->n_comp(sys_num,v) - nc;
2247 
2248  // We should never have fewer dofs than necessary on a
2249  // node unless we're getting indices on a parent element
2250  // or a just-coarsened element
2251  if (dof_offset < 0)
2252  {
2253  libmesh_assert(!elem->active() || elem->refinement_flag() ==
2254  Elem::JUST_COARSENED);
2255  di.resize(di.size() + nc, DofObject::invalid_id);
2256  }
2257  else
2258  for (int i=node->old_dof_object->n_comp(sys_num,v)-1;
2259  i>=dof_offset; i--)
2260  {
2261  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (node->old_dof_object->dof_number(sys_num,v,i),
2262  DofObject::invalid_id);
2263  di.push_back(node->old_dof_object->dof_number(sys_num,v,i));
2264  }
2265  }
2266  // If this is a vertex or an element without extra hanging
2267  // dofs, our dofs come in forward order coming from the
2268  // beginning
2269  else
2270  for (unsigned int i=0; i<nc; i++)
2271  {
2272  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (node->old_dof_object->dof_number(sys_num,v,i),
2273  DofObject::invalid_id);
2274  di.push_back(node->old_dof_object->dof_number(sys_num,v,i));
2275  }
2276  }
2277 
2278  // If there are any element-based DOF numbers, get them
2279  const unsigned int nc = FEInterface::n_dofs_per_elem(dim,
2280  fe_type,
2281  type);
2282 
2283  // We should never have fewer dofs than necessary on an
2284  // element unless we're getting indices on a parent element
2285  // or a just-coarsened element
2286  if (nc != 0)
2287  {
2288  if (elem->old_dof_object->n_systems() > sys_num &&
2289  nc <= elem->old_dof_object->n_comp(sys_num,v))
2290  {
2291  libmesh_assert(elem->old_dof_object);
2292 
2293  for (unsigned int i=0; i<nc; i++)
2294  {
2295  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (elem->old_dof_object->dof_number(sys_num,v,i),
2296  DofObject::invalid_id);
2297 
2298  di.push_back(elem->old_dof_object->dof_number(sys_num,v,i));
2299  }
2300  }
2301  else
2302  {
2303  libmesh_assert(!elem->active() || fe_type.family == LAGRANGE ||
2304  elem->refinement_flag() == Elem::JUST_COARSENED);
2305  di.resize(di.size() + nc, DofObject::invalid_id);
2306  }
2307  }
2308  }
2309  } // end loop over variables
2310 
2311  STOP_LOG("old_dof_indices()", "DofMap");
2312 }

void libMesh::DofMap::prepare_send_list ( )

Takes the _send_list vector (which may have duplicate entries) and sorts it. The duplicate entries are then removed, resulting in a sorted _send_list with unique entries. Also calls any user-provided methods for adding to the send list.

Definition at line 1559 of file dof_map.C.

References _augment_send_list, _extra_send_list_context, _extra_send_list_function, _send_list, libMesh::DofMap::AugmentSendList::augment_send_list(), libMesh::out, libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), and libMesh::swap().

Referenced by libMesh::EquationSystems::allgather(), and libMesh::System::reinit_constraints().

1561  START_LOG("prepare_send_list()", "DofMap");

1563  // Check to see if we have any extra stuff to add to the send_list
1564  if (_extra_send_list_function)
1565  {
1566  if (_augment_send_list)
1567  {
1568  libmesh_here();
1569  libMesh::out << "WARNING: You have specified both an extra send list function and object.\n"
1570  << " Are you sure this is what you meant to do??"
1571  << std::endl;
1572  }

1576

1579 
1580  // First sort the send list. After this
1581  // duplicated elements will be adjacent in the
1582  // vector
1583  std::sort(_send_list.begin(), _send_list.end());
1584

1587  std::unique (_send_list.begin(), _send_list.end());

1589  // Remove the end of the send_list. Use the "swap trick"
1590  // from Effective STL
1591  std::vector<dof_id_type> (_send_list.begin(), new_end).swap (_send_list);
1592 
1593  STOP_LOG("prepare_send_list()", "DofMap");

void libMesh::DofMap::print_dof_constraints ( std::ostream &  os = libMesh::out,
bool  print_nonlocal = false 
) const

Prints (from processor 0) all DoF and Node constraints. If print_nonlocal is true, then each constraint is printed once for each processor that knows about it, which may be useful for ParallelMesh debugging.

Definition at line 1249 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

1256 
1257  if (this->processor_id())
1258  {
1259  this->comm().send(0, local_constraints);
1260  }

1262  {
1263  os << "Processor 0:\n";
1264  os << local_constraints;

1267  {
1268  this->comm().receive(i, local_constraints);
1269  os << "Processor " << i << ":\n";

1272  }

void libMesh::DofMap::process_constraints ( MeshBase &  mesh)

Postprocesses any constrained degrees of freedom to be constrained only in terms of unconstrained dofs, then adds unconstrained dofs to the send_list and prepares that for use. This should be run after both system (create_dof_constraints) and user constraints have all been added.

Definition at line 3168 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::for(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), and libMesh::Real.

Referenced by libMesh::System::reinit_constraints().

3169 {
3170  // We've computed our local constraints, but they may depend on
3171  // non-local constraints that we'll need to take into account.
3172  this->allgather_recursive_constraints(mesh);
3173 
3174  // Create a set containing the DOFs we already depend on
3175  typedef std::set<dof_id_type> RCSet;
3176  RCSet unexpanded_set;
3177 
3178  for (DofConstraints::iterator i = _dof_constraints.begin();
3179  i != _dof_constraints.end(); ++i)
3180  unexpanded_set.insert(i->first);
3181 
3182  while (!unexpanded_set.empty())
3183  for (RCSet::iterator i = unexpanded_set.begin();
3184  i != unexpanded_set.end(); /* nothing */)
3185  {
3186  // If the DOF is constrained
3187  DofConstraints::iterator
3188  pos = _dof_constraints.find(*i);
3189 
3190  libmesh_assert (pos != _dof_constraints.end());
3191 
3192  DofConstraintRow& constraint_row = pos->second;
3193 
3194  DofConstraintValueMap::iterator rhsit =
3195  _primal_constraint_values.find(*i);
3196  Number constraint_rhs = (rhsit == _primal_constraint_values.end()) ?
3197  0 : rhsit->second;
3198 
3199  std::vector<dof_id_type> constraints_to_expand;
3200 
3201  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
3202  it=constraint_row.begin(); it != constraint_row.end();
3203  ++it)
3204  if (it->first != *i && this->is_constrained_dof(it->first))
3205  {
3206  unexpanded_set.insert(it->first);
3207  constraints_to_expand.push_back(it->first);
3208  }
3209 
3210  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != constraints_to_expand.size();
3211  ++j)
3212  {
3213  dof_id_type expandable = constraints_to_expand[j];
3214 
3215  const Real this_coef = constraint_row[expandable];
3216 
3217  DofConstraints::const_iterator
3218  subpos = _dof_constraints.find(expandable);
3219 
3220  libmesh_assert (subpos != _dof_constraints.end());
3221 
3222  const DofConstraintRow& subconstraint_row = subpos->second;
3223 
3224  for (DofConstraintRow::const_iterator
3225  it=subconstraint_row.begin();
3226  it != subconstraint_row.end(); ++it)
3227  {
3228  constraint_row[it->first] += it->second * this_coef;
3229  }
3230  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator subrhsit =
3231  _primal_constraint_values.find(expandable);
3232  if (subrhsit != _primal_constraint_values.end())
3233  constraint_rhs += subrhsit->second * this_coef;
3234 
3235  constraint_row.erase(expandable);
3236  }
3237 
3238  if (rhsit == _primal_constraint_values.end())
3239  {
3240  if (constraint_rhs != Number(0))
3241  _primal_constraint_values[*i] = constraint_rhs;
3242  else
3243  _primal_constraint_values.erase(*i);
3244  }
3245  else
3246  {
3247  if (constraint_rhs != Number(0))
3248  rhsit->second = constraint_rhs;
3249  else
3250  _primal_constraint_values.erase(rhsit);
3251  }
3252 
3253  if (constraints_to_expand.empty())
3254  unexpanded_set.erase(i++);
3255  else
3256  ++i;
3257  }
3258 
3259  // In parallel we can't guarantee that nodes/dofs which constrain
3260  // others are on processors which are aware of that constraint, yet
3261  // we need such awareness for sparsity pattern generation. So send
3262  // other processors any constraints they might need to know about.
3263  this->scatter_constraints(mesh);
3264 
3265  // Now that we have our root constraint dependencies sorted out, add
3266  // them to the send_list
3267  this->add_constraints_to_send_list();
3268 }

libMesh::ParallelObject::_communicator
const Parallel::Communicator & _communicator

libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::rank
unsigned int rank() const
Definition: parallel.h:697
void libMesh::DofMap::reinit ( MeshBase &  mesh)

Reinitialize the underlying data strucures conformal to the current mesh.

Definition at line 439 of file dof_map.C.

References _n_SCALAR_dofs, libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_end(), libMesh::Variable::active_on_subdomain(), libMesh::dim, libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_end(), libMesh::Utility::enum_to_string(), libMesh::err, libMesh::FEInterface::extra_hanging_dofs(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::Elem::get_node(), libMesh::DofObject::has_dofs(), invalidate_dofs(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_prepared(), libMesh::Elem::is_vertex(), libMesh::Elem::JUST_REFINED, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), std::max(), libMesh::FEInterface::max_order(), libMesh::DofObject::n_comp_group(), libMesh::FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node(), libMesh::FEInterface::n_dofs_per_elem(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), n_variable_groups(), libMesh::VariableGroup::n_variables(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_end(), libMesh::DofObject::old_dof_object, libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::Elem::p_level(), libMesh::Elem::refinement_flag(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::DofObject::set_n_comp_group(), libMesh::DofObject::set_old_dof_object(), libMesh::Elem::set_p_level(), libMesh::DofObject::set_vg_dof_base(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::Elem::subdomain_id(), sys_number(), libMesh::Variable::type(), libMesh::Elem::type(), variable_group(), and libMesh::DofObject::vg_dof_base().

Referenced by distribute_dofs().

440 {
441  libmesh_assert (mesh.is_prepared());
442 
443  START_LOG("reinit()", "DofMap");
444 
445  const unsigned int
446  sys_num = this->sys_number(),
447  n_var_groups = this->n_variable_groups();
448 
449  // The DofObjects need to know how many variable groups we have, and
450  // how many variables there are in each group.
451  std::vector<unsigned int> n_vars_per_group; n_vars_per_group.reserve (n_var_groups);
452 
453  for (unsigned int vg=0; vg<n_var_groups; vg++)
454  n_vars_per_group.push_back (this->variable_group(vg).n_variables());
455 
456 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
457 
458  //------------------------------------------------------------
459  // Clear the old_dof_objects for all the nodes
460  // and elements so that we can overwrite them
461  {
462  MeshBase::node_iterator node_it = mesh.nodes_begin();
463  const MeshBase::node_iterator node_end = mesh.nodes_end();
464 
465  for ( ; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
466  {
467  (*node_it)->clear_old_dof_object();
468  libmesh_assert (!(*node_it)->old_dof_object);
469  }
470 
471  MeshBase::element_iterator elem_it = mesh.elements_begin();
472  const MeshBase::element_iterator elem_end = mesh.elements_end();
473 
474  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
475  {
476  (*elem_it)->clear_old_dof_object();
477  libmesh_assert (!(*elem_it)->old_dof_object);
478  }
479  }
480 
481 
482  //------------------------------------------------------------
483  // Set the old_dof_objects for the elements that
484  // weren't just created, if these old dof objects
485  // had variables
486  {
487  MeshBase::element_iterator elem_it = mesh.elements_begin();
488  const MeshBase::element_iterator elem_end = mesh.elements_end();
489 
490  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
491  {
492  Elem* elem = *elem_it;
493 
494  // Skip the elements that were just refined
495  if (elem->refinement_flag() == Elem::JUST_REFINED) continue;
496 
497  for (unsigned int n=0; n<elem->n_nodes(); n++)
498  {
499  Node* node = elem->get_node(n);
500 
501  if (node->old_dof_object == NULL)
502  if (node->has_dofs(sys_num))
503  node->set_old_dof_object();
504  }
505 
506  libmesh_assert (!elem->old_dof_object);
507 
508  if (elem->has_dofs(sys_num))
509  elem->set_old_dof_object();
510  }
511  }
512 
513 #endif // #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
514 
515 
516  //------------------------------------------------------------
517  // Then set the number of variables for each \p DofObject
518  // equal to n_variables() for this system. This will
519  // handle new \p DofObjects that may have just been created
520  {
521  // All the nodes
522  MeshBase::node_iterator node_it = mesh.nodes_begin();
523  const MeshBase::node_iterator node_end = mesh.nodes_end();
524 
525  for ( ; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
526  (*node_it)->set_n_vars_per_group(sys_num, n_vars_per_group);
527 
528  // All the elements
529  MeshBase::element_iterator elem_it = mesh.elements_begin();
530  const MeshBase::element_iterator elem_end = mesh.elements_end();
531 
532  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
533  (*elem_it)->set_n_vars_per_group(sys_num, n_vars_per_group);
534  }
535 
536 
537  // Zero _n_SCALAR_dofs, it will be updated below.
538  this->_n_SCALAR_dofs = 0;
539 
540  //------------------------------------------------------------
541  // Next allocate space for the DOF indices
542  for (unsigned int vg=0; vg<n_var_groups; vg++)
543  {
544  const VariableGroup &vg_description = this->variable_group(vg);
545 
546  const unsigned int n_var_in_group = vg_description.n_variables();
547  const FEType& base_fe_type = vg_description.type();
548 
549  // Don't need to loop over elements for a SCALAR variable
550  // Just increment _n_SCALAR_dofs
551  if(base_fe_type.family == SCALAR)
552  {
553  this->_n_SCALAR_dofs += base_fe_type.order*n_var_in_group;
554  continue;
555  }
556 
557  // This should be constant even on p-refined elements
558  const bool extra_hanging_dofs =
559  FEInterface::extra_hanging_dofs(base_fe_type);
560 
561  // For all the active elements
562  MeshBase::element_iterator elem_it = mesh.active_elements_begin();
563  const MeshBase::element_iterator elem_end = mesh.active_elements_end();
564 
565  // Count vertex degrees of freedom first
566  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
567  {
568  Elem* elem = *elem_it;
569  libmesh_assert(elem);
570 
571  // Skip the numbering if this variable is
572  // not active on this element's subdomain
573  if (!vg_description.active_on_subdomain(elem->subdomain_id()))
574  continue;
575 
576  const ElemType type = elem->type();
577  const unsigned int dim = elem->dim();
578 
579  FEType fe_type = base_fe_type;
580 
581 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
582  // Make sure we haven't done more p refinement than we can
583  // handle
584  if (elem->p_level() + base_fe_type.order >
585  FEInterface::max_order(base_fe_type, type))
586  {
587 # ifdef DEBUG
588  if (FEInterface::max_order(base_fe_type,type) < static_cast<unsigned int>(base_fe_type.order))
589  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: Finite element " \
590  << Utility::enum_to_string(base_fe_type.family) \
591  << " on geometric element " \
592  << Utility::enum_to_string(type) \
593  << "\nonly supports FEInterface::max_order = " \
594  << FEInterface::max_order(base_fe_type,type) \
595  << ", not fe_type.order = " \
596  << base_fe_type.order);
597 
598  libMesh::err
599  << "WARNING: Finite element "
600  << Utility::enum_to_string(base_fe_type.family)
601  << " on geometric element "
602  << Utility::enum_to_string(type) << std::endl
603  << "could not be p refined past FEInterface::max_order = "
604  << FEInterface::max_order(base_fe_type,type)
605  << std::endl;
606 # endif
607  elem->set_p_level(FEInterface::max_order(base_fe_type,type)
608  - base_fe_type.order);
609  }
610 #endif
611 
612  fe_type.order = static_cast<Order>(fe_type.order +
613  elem->p_level());
614 
615  // Allocate the vertex DOFs
616  for (unsigned int n=0; n<elem->n_nodes(); n++)
617  {
618  Node* node = elem->get_node(n);
619 
620  if (elem->is_vertex(n))
621  {
622  const unsigned int old_node_dofs =
623  node->n_comp_group(sys_num, vg);
624 
625  const unsigned int vertex_dofs =
626  std::max(FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node(dim, fe_type,
627  type, n),
628  old_node_dofs);
629 
630  // Some discontinuous FEs have no vertex dofs
631  if (vertex_dofs > old_node_dofs)
632  {
633  node->set_n_comp_group(sys_num, vg,
634  vertex_dofs);
635 
636  // Abusing dof_number to set a "this is a
637  // vertex" flag
638  node->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num, vg,
639  vertex_dofs);
640 
641  // libMesh::out << "sys_num,vg,old_node_dofs,vertex_dofs="
642  // << sys_num << ","
643  // << vg << ","
644  // << old_node_dofs << ","
645  // << vertex_dofs << '\n',
646  // node->debug_buffer();
647 
648  // libmesh_assert_equal_to (vertex_dofs, node->n_comp(sys_num, vg));
649  // libmesh_assert_equal_to (vertex_dofs, node->vg_dof_base(sys_num, vg));
650  }
651  }
652  }
653  } // done counting vertex dofs
654 
655  // count edge & face dofs next
656  elem_it = mesh.active_elements_begin();
657 
658  for ( ; elem_it != elem_end; ++elem_it)
659  {
660  Elem* elem = *elem_it;
661  libmesh_assert(elem);
662 
663  // Skip the numbering if this variable is
664  // not active on this element's subdomain
665  if (!vg_description.active_on_subdomain(elem->subdomain_id()))
666  continue;
667 
668  const ElemType type = elem->type();
669  const unsigned int dim = elem->dim();
670 
671  FEType fe_type = base_fe_type;
672  fe_type.order = static_cast<Order>(fe_type.order +
673  elem->p_level());
674 
675  // Allocate the edge and face DOFs
676  for (unsigned int n=0; n<elem->n_nodes(); n++)
677  {
678  Node* node = elem->get_node(n);
679 
680  const unsigned int old_node_dofs =
681  node->n_comp_group(sys_num, vg);
682 
683  const unsigned int vertex_dofs = old_node_dofs?
684  cast_int<unsigned int>(node->vg_dof_base (sys_num,vg)):0;
685 
686  const unsigned int new_node_dofs =
687  FEInterface::n_dofs_at_node(dim, fe_type, type, n);
688 
689  // We've already allocated vertex DOFs
690  if (elem->is_vertex(n))
691  {
692  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (old_node_dofs, vertex_dofs);
693  // //if (vertex_dofs < new_node_dofs)
694  // libMesh::out << "sys_num,vg,old_node_dofs,vertex_dofs,new_node_dofs="
695  // << sys_num << ","
696  // << vg << ","
697  // << old_node_dofs << ","
698  // << vertex_dofs << ","
699  // << new_node_dofs << '\n',
700  // node->debug_buffer();
701 
702  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (vertex_dofs, new_node_dofs);
703  }
704  // We need to allocate the rest
705  else
706  {
707  // If this has no dofs yet, it needs no vertex
708  // dofs, so we just give it edge or face dofs
709  if (!old_node_dofs)
710  {
711  node->set_n_comp_group(sys_num, vg,
712  new_node_dofs);
713  // Abusing dof_number to set a "this has no
714  // vertex dofs" flag
715  if (new_node_dofs)
716  node->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num, vg,
717  0);
718  }
719 
720  // If this has dofs, but has no vertex dofs,
721  // it may still need more edge or face dofs if
722  // we're p-refined.
723  else if (vertex_dofs == 0)
724  {
725  if (new_node_dofs > old_node_dofs)
726  {
727  node->set_n_comp_group(sys_num, vg,
728  new_node_dofs);
729 
730  node->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num, vg,
731  vertex_dofs);
732  }
733  }
734  // If this is another element's vertex,
735  // add more (non-overlapping) edge/face dofs if
736  // necessary
737  else if (extra_hanging_dofs)
738  {
739  if (new_node_dofs > old_node_dofs - vertex_dofs)
740  {
741  node->set_n_comp_group(sys_num, vg,
742  vertex_dofs + new_node_dofs);
743 
744  node->set_vg_dof_base(sys_num, vg,
745  vertex_dofs);
746  }
747  }
748  // If this is another element's vertex, add any
749  // (overlapping) edge/face dofs if necessary
750  else
751  {
752  libmesh_assert_greater_equal (old_node_dofs, vertex_dofs);
753  if (new_node_dofs > old_node_dofs)
754  {
755  node->set_n_comp_group(sys_num, vg,
756  new_node_dofs);
757 
758  node->set_vg_dof_base (sys_num, vg,
759  vertex_dofs);
760  }
761  }
762  }
763  }
764  // Allocate the element DOFs
765  const unsigned int dofs_per_elem =
766  FEInterface::n_dofs_per_elem(dim, fe_type,
767  type);
768 
769  elem->set_n_comp_group(sys_num, vg, dofs_per_elem);
770 
771  }
772  } // end loop over variable groups
773 
774  // Calling DofMap::reinit() by itself makes little sense,
775  // so we won't bother with nonlocal DofObjects.
776  // Those will be fixed by distribute_dofs
777 
778  //------------------------------------------------------------
779  // Finally, clear all the current DOF indices
780  // (distribute_dofs expects them cleared!)
781  this->invalidate_dofs(mesh);
782 
783  STOP_LOG("reinit()", "DofMap");
784 }

void libMesh::DofMap::SCALAR_dof_indices ( std::vector< dof_id_type > &  di,
const unsigned int  vn,
const bool  old_dofs = false 
) const

Fills the vector di with the global degree of freedom indices corresponding to the SCALAR variable vn. If old_dofs=true, the old SCALAR dof indices are returned. Note that we do not need to pass in an element since SCALARs are global variables.

Definition at line 2085 of file dof_map.C.

References _first_old_scalar_df, _first_scalar_df, libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), n_old_dofs(), n_SCALAR_dofs(), libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::Variable::type(), and variable().

Referenced by add_neighbors_to_send_list(), dof_indices(), local_variable_indices(), old_dof_indices(), libMesh::System::project_vector(), libMesh::System::read_parallel_data(), libMesh::System::read_SCALAR_dofs(), libMesh::System::write_parallel_data(), and libMesh::System::write_SCALAR_dofs().

2094  START_LOG("SCALAR_dof_indices()", "DofMap");
2095 
2096  libmesh_assert(this->variable(vn).type().family == SCALAR);
2097 
2098 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
2099  // If we're asking for old dofs then we'd better have some
2100  if (old_dofs)
2101  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(n_old_dofs(), n_SCALAR_dofs());
2102 
2103  dof_id_type my_idx = old_dofs ?
2104  this->_first_old_scalar_df[vn] : this->_first_scalar_df[vn];
2105 #else
2106  dof_id_type my_idx = this->_first_scalar_df[vn];
2107 #endif
2108 
2109  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to(my_idx, DofObject::invalid_id);
2110 
2111  // The number of SCALAR dofs comes from the variable order
2112  const int n_dofs_vn = this->variable(vn).type().order;
2113

2115  for(int i = 0; i != n_dofs_vn; ++i)
2116  di[i] = my_idx++;
