void libMesh::DofMap::scatter_constraints ( MeshBase &  mesh)

Sends constraint equations to constraining processors

Definition at line 3271 of file dof_map_constraints.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::active_not_local_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_not_local_elements_end(), libMesh::comm, end, libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), mesh, libMesh::n_processors(), libMesh::MeshBase::node_ptr(), libMesh::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), and libMesh::TypeVector< T >::size().

3272 {
3273  // At this point each processor with a constrained node knows
3274  // the corresponding constraint row, but we also need each processor
3275  // with a constrainer node to know the corresponding row(s).
3276 
3277  // This function must be run on all processors at once
3278  parallel_object_only();
3279 
3280  // Return immediately if there's nothing to gather
3281  if (this->n_processors() == 1)
3282  return;
3283 
3284  // We might get to return immediately if none of the processors
3285  // found any constraints
3286  unsigned int has_constraints = !_dof_constraints.empty()
3287 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3288  || !_node_constraints.empty()
3289 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3290  ;
3291  this->comm().max(has_constraints);
3292  if (!has_constraints)
3293  return;
3294 
3295 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3296  std::vector<std::set<dof_id_type> > pushed_node_ids(this->n_processors());
3297 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3298 
3299  std::vector<std::set<dof_id_type> > pushed_ids(this->n_processors());
3300 
3301  // Collect the dof constraints I need to push to each processor
3302  dof_id_type constrained_proc_id = 0;
3303  for (DofConstraints::iterator i = _dof_constraints.begin();
3304  i != _dof_constraints.end(); ++i)
3305  {
3306  const dof_id_type constrained = i->first;
3307  while (constrained >= _end_df[constrained_proc_id])
3308  constrained_proc_id++;
3309 
3310  if (constrained_proc_id != this->processor_id())
3311  continue;
3312 
3313  DofConstraintRow &row = i->second;
3314  for (DofConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
3315  j != row.end(); ++j)
3316  {
3317  const dof_id_type constraining = j->first;
3318 
3319  processor_id_type constraining_proc_id = 0;
3320  while (constraining >= _end_df[constraining_proc_id])
3321  constraining_proc_id++;
3322 
3323  if (constraining_proc_id != this->processor_id() &&
3324  constraining_proc_id != constrained_proc_id)
3325  pushed_ids[constraining_proc_id].insert(constrained);
3326  }
3327  }
3328 
3329 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3330  // Collect the node constraints to push to each processor
3331  for (NodeConstraints::iterator i = _node_constraints.begin();
3332  i != _node_constraints.end(); ++i)
3333  {
3334  const Node *constrained = i->first;
3335 
3336  if (constrained->processor_id() != this->processor_id())
3337  continue;
3338 
3339  NodeConstraintRow &row = i->second.first;
3340  for (NodeConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
3341  j != row.end(); ++j)
3342  {
3343  const Node *constraining = j->first;
3344 
3345  if (constraining->processor_id() != this->processor_id() &&
3346  constraining->processor_id() != constrained->processor_id())
3347  pushed_node_ids[constraining->processor_id()].insert(constrained->id());
3348  }
3349  }
3350 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3351 
3352  // Now trade constraint rows
3353  for (processor_id_type p = 0; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
3354  {
3355  // Push to processor procup while receiving from procdown
3356  processor_id_type procup =
3357  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->processor_id() + p) %
3358  this->n_processors());
3359  processor_id_type procdown =
3360  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->n_processors() +
3361  this->processor_id() - p) %
3362  this->n_processors());
3363 
3364  // Pack the dof constraint rows and rhs's to push to procup
3365  const std::size_t pushed_ids_size = pushed_ids[procup].size();
3366  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_keys(pushed_ids_size);
3367  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_vals(pushed_ids_size);
3368  std::vector<Number> pushed_rhss(pushed_ids_size);
3369 
3370  std::set<dof_id_type>::const_iterator it;
3371  std::size_t push_i;
3372  for (push_i = 0, it = pushed_ids[procup].begin();
3373  it != pushed_ids[procup].end(); ++push_i, ++it)
3374  {
3375  const dof_id_type constrained = *it;
3376  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[constrained];
3377  std::size_t row_size = row.size();
3378  pushed_keys[push_i].reserve(row_size);
3379  pushed_vals[push_i].reserve(row_size);
3380  for (DofConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
3381  j != row.end(); ++j)
3382  {
3383  pushed_keys[push_i].push_back(j->first);
3384  pushed_vals[push_i].push_back(j->second);
3385  }
3386 
3387  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
3388  _primal_constraint_values.find(constrained);
3389  pushed_rhss[push_i] = (rhsit == _primal_constraint_values.end()) ?
3390  0 : rhsit->second;
3391  }
3392 
3393 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3394  // Pack the node constraint rows to push to procup
3395  const std::size_t pushed_node_ids_size = pushed_node_ids[procup].size();
3396  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_node_keys(pushed_node_ids_size);
3397  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_node_vals(pushed_node_ids_size);
3398  std::vector<Point> pushed_node_offsets(pushed_node_ids_size);
3399  std::set<const Node*> pushed_nodes;
3400 
3401  for (push_i = 0, it = pushed_node_ids[procup].begin();
3402  it != pushed_node_ids[procup].end(); ++push_i, ++it)
3403  {
3404  const Node *constrained = mesh.node_ptr(*it);
3405 
3406  if (constrained->processor_id() != procdown)
3407  pushed_nodes.insert(constrained);
3408 
3409  NodeConstraintRow &row = _node_constraints[constrained].first;
3410  std::size_t row_size = row.size();
3411  pushed_node_keys[push_i].reserve(row_size);
3412  pushed_node_vals[push_i].reserve(row_size);
3413  for (NodeConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
3414  j != row.end(); ++j)
3415  {
3416  const Node* constraining = j->first;
3417 
3418  pushed_node_keys[push_i].push_back(constraining->id());
3419  pushed_node_vals[push_i].push_back(j->second);
3420 
3421  if (constraining->processor_id() != procup)
3422  pushed_nodes.insert(constraining);
3423  }
3424  pushed_node_offsets[push_i] = _node_constraints[constrained].second;
3425  }
3426 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3427 
3428  // Trade pushed dof constraint rows
3429  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_ids_from_me
3430  (pushed_ids[procup].begin(), pushed_ids[procup].end());
3431  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_ids_to_me;
3432  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_keys_to_me;
3433  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_vals_to_me;
3434  std::vector<Number> pushed_rhss_to_me;
3435  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_ids_from_me,
3436  procdown, pushed_ids_to_me);
3437  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_keys,
3438  procdown, pushed_keys_to_me);
3439  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_vals,
3440  procdown, pushed_vals_to_me);
3441  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_rhss,
3442  procdown, pushed_rhss_to_me);
3443  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_keys_to_me.size());
3444  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_vals_to_me.size());
3445  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_rhss_to_me.size());
3446 
3447 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3448  // Trade pushed node constraint rows
3449  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_node_ids_from_me
3450  (pushed_node_ids[procup].begin(), pushed_node_ids[procup].end());
3451  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_node_ids_to_me;
3452  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_node_keys_to_me;
3453  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_node_vals_to_me;
3454  std::vector<Point> pushed_node_offsets_to_me;
3455  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_ids_from_me,
3456  procdown, pushed_node_ids_to_me);
3457  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_keys,
3458  procdown, pushed_node_keys_to_me);
3459  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_vals,
3460  procdown, pushed_node_vals_to_me);
3461  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_node_offsets,
3462  procdown, pushed_node_offsets_to_me);
3463 
3464  // Constraining nodes might not even exist on our subset of
3465  // a distributed mesh, so let's make them exist.
3466  if (!mesh.is_serial())
3467  this->comm().send_receive_packed_range
3468  (procup, &mesh, pushed_nodes.begin(), pushed_nodes.end(),
3469  procdown, &mesh, mesh_inserter_iterator<Node>(mesh));
3470 
3471  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_node_keys_to_me.size());
3472  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_node_vals_to_me.size());
3473  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_node_offsets_to_me.size());
3474 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3475 
3476  // Add the dof constraints that I've been sent
3477  for (std::size_t i = 0; i != pushed_ids_to_me.size(); ++i)
3478  {
3479  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_keys_to_me[i].size(), pushed_vals_to_me[i].size());
3480 
3481  dof_id_type constrained = pushed_ids_to_me[i];
3482 
3483  // If we don't already have a constraint for this dof,
3484  // add the one we were sent
3485  if (!this->is_constrained_dof(constrained))
3486  {
3487  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[constrained];
3488  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != pushed_keys_to_me[i].size(); ++j)
3489  {
3490  row[pushed_keys_to_me[i][j]] = pushed_vals_to_me[i][j];
3491  }
3492  if (pushed_rhss_to_me[i] != Number(0))
3493  _primal_constraint_values[constrained] = pushed_rhss_to_me[i];
3494  else
3495  _primal_constraint_values.erase(constrained);
3496  }
3497  }
3498 
3499 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3500  // Add the node constraints that I've been sent
3501  for (std::size_t i = 0; i != pushed_node_ids_to_me.size(); ++i)
3502  {
3503  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_node_keys_to_me[i].size(), pushed_node_vals_to_me[i].size());
3504 
3505  dof_id_type constrained_id = pushed_node_ids_to_me[i];
3506 
3507  // If we don't already have a constraint for this node,
3508  // add the one we were sent
3509  const Node *constrained = mesh.node_ptr(constrained_id);
3510  if (!this->is_constrained_node(constrained))
3511  {
3512  NodeConstraintRow &row = _node_constraints[constrained].first;
3513  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != pushed_node_keys_to_me[i].size(); ++j)
3514  {
3515  const Node *key_node = mesh.node_ptr(pushed_node_keys_to_me[i][j]);
3516  libmesh_assert(key_node);
3517  row[key_node] = pushed_node_vals_to_me[i][j];
3518  }
3519  _node_constraints[constrained].second = pushed_node_offsets_to_me[i];
3520  }
3521  }
3522 #endif // LIBMESH_ENABLE_NODE_CONSTRAINTS
3523  }
3524 
3525  // Next we need to push constraints to processors which don't own
3526  // the constrained dof, don't own the constraining dof, but own an
3527  // element supporting the constraining dof.
3528  //
3529  // We need to be able to quickly look up constrained dof ids by what
3530  // constrains them, so that we can handle the case where we see a
3531  // foreign element containing one of our constraining DoF ids and we
3532  // need to push that constraint.
3533  //
3534  // Getting distributed adaptive sparsity patterns right is hard.
3535 
3536  typedef std::map<dof_id_type, std::set<dof_id_type> > DofConstrainsMap;
3537  DofConstrainsMap dof_id_constrains;
3538 
3539  for (DofConstraints::iterator i = _dof_constraints.begin();
3540  i != _dof_constraints.end(); ++i)
3541  {
3542  const dof_id_type constrained = i->first;
3543  DofConstraintRow &row = i->second;
3544  for (DofConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
3545  j != row.end(); ++j)
3546  {
3547  const dof_id_type constraining = j->first;
3548 
3549  dof_id_type constraining_proc_id = 0;
3550  while (constraining >= _end_df[constraining_proc_id])
3551  constraining_proc_id++;
3552 
3553  if (constraining_proc_id == this->processor_id())
3554  dof_id_constrains[constraining].insert(constrained);
3555  }
3556  }
3557 
3558  // Loop over all foreign elements, find any supporting our
3559  // constrained dof indices.
3560  pushed_ids.clear();
3561  pushed_ids.resize(this->n_processors());
3562 
3563  MeshBase::const_element_iterator it = mesh.active_not_local_elements_begin(),
3564  end = mesh.active_not_local_elements_end();
3565  for (; it != end; ++it)
3566  {
3567  const Elem *elem = *it;
3568 
3569  std::vector<dof_id_type> my_dof_indices;
3570  this->dof_indices (elem, my_dof_indices);
3571 
3572  for (std::size_t i=0; i != my_dof_indices.size(); ++i)
3573  {
3574  DofConstrainsMap::const_iterator dcmi =
3575  dof_id_constrains.find(my_dof_indices[i]);
3576  if (dcmi != dof_id_constrains.end())
3577  {
3578  for (DofConstrainsMap::mapped_type::const_iterator mti =
3579  dcmi->second.begin();
3580  mti != dcmi->second.end(); ++mti)
3581  {
3582  const dof_id_type constrained = *mti;
3583 
3584  dof_id_type the_constrained_proc_id = 0;
3585  while (constrained >= _end_df[the_constrained_proc_id])
3586  the_constrained_proc_id++;
3587 
3588  const dof_id_type elemproc = elem->processor_id();
3589  if (elemproc != the_constrained_proc_id)
3590  pushed_ids[elemproc].insert(constrained);
3591  }
3592  }
3593  }
3594  }
3595 
3596  // One last trade of constraint rows
3597  for (processor_id_type p = 0; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
3598  {
3599  // Push to processor procup while receiving from procdown
3600  processor_id_type procup =
3601  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->processor_id() + p) %
3602  this->n_processors());
3603  processor_id_type procdown =
3604  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->n_processors() +
3605  this->processor_id() - p) %
3606  this->n_processors());
3607 
3608  // Pack the dof constraint rows and rhs's to push to procup
3609  const std::size_t pushed_ids_size = pushed_ids[procup].size();
3610  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_keys(pushed_ids_size);
3611  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_vals(pushed_ids_size);
3612  std::vector<Number> pushed_rhss(pushed_ids_size);
3613 
3614  // As long as we're declaring them outside the loop, let's initialize them too!
3615  std::set<dof_id_type>::const_iterator pushed_ids_iter = pushed_ids[procup].begin();
3616  std::size_t push_i = 0;
3617  for ( ; pushed_ids_iter != pushed_ids[procup].end(); ++push_i, ++pushed_ids_iter)
3618  {
3619  const dof_id_type constrained = *pushed_ids_iter;
3620  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[constrained];
3621  std::size_t row_size = row.size();
3622  pushed_keys[push_i].reserve(row_size);
3623  pushed_vals[push_i].reserve(row_size);
3624  for (DofConstraintRow::iterator j = row.begin();
3625  j != row.end(); ++j)
3626  {
3627  pushed_keys[push_i].push_back(j->first);
3628  pushed_vals[push_i].push_back(j->second);
3629  }
3630 
3631  DofConstraintValueMap::const_iterator rhsit =
3632  _primal_constraint_values.find(constrained);
3633  pushed_rhss[push_i] = (rhsit == _primal_constraint_values.end()) ?
3634  0 : rhsit->second;
3635  }
3636 
3637  // Trade pushed dof constraint rows
3638  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_ids_from_me
3639  (pushed_ids[procup].begin(), pushed_ids[procup].end());
3640  std::vector<dof_id_type> pushed_ids_to_me;
3641  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> > pushed_keys_to_me;
3642  std::vector<std::vector<Real> > pushed_vals_to_me;
3643  std::vector<Number> pushed_rhss_to_me;
3644  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_ids_from_me,
3645  procdown, pushed_ids_to_me);
3646  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_keys,
3647  procdown, pushed_keys_to_me);
3648  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_vals,
3649  procdown, pushed_vals_to_me);
3650  this->comm().send_receive(procup, pushed_rhss,
3651  procdown, pushed_rhss_to_me);
3652  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_keys_to_me.size());
3653  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_vals_to_me.size());
3654  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_ids_to_me.size(), pushed_rhss_to_me.size());
3655 
3656  // Add the dof constraints that I've been sent
3657  for (std::size_t i = 0; i != pushed_ids_to_me.size(); ++i)
3658  {
3659  libmesh_assert_equal_to (pushed_keys_to_me[i].size(), pushed_vals_to_me[i].size());
3660 
3661  dof_id_type constrained = pushed_ids_to_me[i];
3662 
3663  // If we don't already have a constraint for this dof,
3664  // add the one we were sent
3665  if (!this->is_constrained_dof(constrained))
3666  {
3667  DofConstraintRow &row = _dof_constraints[constrained];
3668  for (std::size_t j = 0; j != pushed_keys_to_me[i].size(); ++j)
3669  {
3670  row[pushed_keys_to_me[i][j]] = pushed_vals_to_me[i][j];
3671  }
3672 
3673  if (pushed_rhss_to_me[i] != Number(0))
3674  _primal_constraint_values[constrained] = pushed_rhss_to_me[i];
3675  else
3676  _primal_constraint_values.erase(constrained);
3677  }
3678  }
3679  }
3680 }

Definition: variant_filter_iterator.h:334
libMesh::DofMap::is_constrained_dof

void send_receive_packed_range(const unsigned int dest_processor_id, const Context1 *context1, RangeIter send_begin, const RangeIter send_end, const unsigned int source_processor_id, Context2 *context2, OutputIter out, const MessageTag &send_tag=no_tag, const MessageTag &recv_tag=any_tag) const

libMesh::ParallelObject::comm

libMesh::DofMap::_primal_constraint_values

Definition: dof_map.h:1380
libMesh::DofConstraintRow
std::map< dof_id_type, Real, std::less< dof_id_type >, Threads::scalable_allocator< std::pair< const dof_id_type, Real > > > DofConstraintRow
Definition: dof_map.h:86

std::vector< dof_id_type > _end_df
Definition: dof_map.h:1265
libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::send_receive

libMesh::NodeConstraintRow
std::map< const Node *, Real, std::less< const Node * >, Threads::scalable_allocator< std::pair< const Node *const, Real > > > NodeConstraintRow

libMesh::TypeVector::size

Definition: libmesh_common.h:181
libMesh::MeshBase::node_ptr

libMesh::DofObject::id

libMesh::dof_id_type
uint8_t dof_id_type
Definition: id_types.h:64
libMesh::DofObject::processor_id
processor_id_type processor_id() const

libMesh::DofMap::_node_constraints
NodeConstraints _node_constraints
Definition: dof_map.h:1389
libMesh::DofMap::dof_indices
void dof_indices(const Elem *const elem, std::vector< dof_id_type > &di) const
Definition: dof_map.C:1805
void libMesh::DofMap::set_implicit_neighbor_dofs ( bool  implicit_neighbor_dofs)

Allow the implicit_neighbor_dofs flag to be set programmatically. This overrides the –implicit_neighbor_dofs commandline option. We can use this to set the implicit neighbor dofs option differently for different systems, whereas the commandline option is the same for all systems.

Definition at line 1597 of file dof_map.C.

References _implicit_neighbor_dofs, and _implicit_neighbor_dofs_initialized.

1598 {
1599  _implicit_neighbor_dofs_initialized = true;
1600  _implicit_neighbor_dofs = implicit_neighbor_dofs;
1601 }
libMesh::DofMap::_implicit_neighbor_dofs_initialized
bool _implicit_neighbor_dofs_initialized
Definition: dof_map.h:1421
libMesh::DofMap::_implicit_neighbor_dofs
bool _implicit_neighbor_dofs
Definition: dof_map.h:1422
template<typename iterator_type >
void libMesh::DofMap::set_nonlocal_dof_objects ( iterator_type  objects_begin,
iterator_type  objects_end,
MeshBase &  mesh,
dofobject_accessor  objects 
)
private

Helper function for distributing dofs in parallel

Definition at line 289 of file dof_map.C.

References libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::allgather(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::DofObject::dof_number(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::DofObject::n_comp(), libMesh::DofObject::n_comp_group(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::DofObject::n_var_groups(), n_variable_groups(), libMesh::DofObject::n_vars(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::send_receive(), libMesh::DofObject::set_n_comp_group(), libMesh::DofObject::set_vg_dof_base(), sys_number(), and libMesh::DofObject::vg_dof_base().

Referenced by distribute_dofs().

293 {
294  // This function must be run on all processors at once
295  parallel_object_only();
296 
297  // First, iterate over local objects to find out how many
298  // are on each processor
299  std::vector<dof_id_type>
300  ghost_objects_from_proc(this->n_processors(), 0);
301 
302  iterator_type it = objects_begin;
303 
304  for (; it != objects_end; ++it)
305  {
306  DofObject *obj = *it;
307 
308  if (obj)
309  {
310  processor_id_type obj_procid = obj->processor_id();
311  // We'd better be completely partitioned by now
312  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (obj_procid, DofObject::invalid_processor_id);
313  ghost_objects_from_proc[obj_procid]++;
314  }
315  }
316 
317  std::vector<dof_id_type> objects_on_proc(this->n_processors(), 0);
318  this->comm().allgather(ghost_objects_from_proc[this->processor_id()],
319  objects_on_proc);
320 
321 #ifdef DEBUG
322  for (processor_id_type p=0; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
323  libmesh_assert_less_equal (ghost_objects_from_proc[p], objects_on_proc[p]);
324 #endif
325 
326  // Request sets to send to each processor
327  std::vector<std::vector<dof_id_type> >
328  requested_ids(this->n_processors());
329 
330  // We know how many of our objects live on each processor, so
331  // reserve() space for requests from each.
332  for (processor_id_type p=0; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
333  if (p != this->processor_id())
334  requested_ids[p].reserve(ghost_objects_from_proc[p]);
335 
336  for (it = objects_begin; it != objects_end; ++it)
337  {
338  DofObject *obj = *it;
339  if (obj->processor_id() != DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
340  requested_ids[obj->processor_id()].push_back(obj->id());
341  }
342 #ifdef DEBUG
343  for (processor_id_type p=0; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
344  libmesh_assert_equal_to (requested_ids[p].size(), ghost_objects_from_proc[p]);
345 #endif
346 
347  // Next set ghost object n_comps from other processors
348  for (processor_id_type p=1; p != this->n_processors(); ++p)
349  {
350  // Trade my requests with processor procup and procdown
351  processor_id_type procup =
352  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->processor_id() + p) %
353  this->n_processors());
354  processor_id_type procdown =
355  cast_int<processor_id_type>((this->n_processors() +
356  this->processor_id() - p) %
357  this->n_processors());
358  std::vector<dof_id_type> request_to_fill;
359  this->comm().send_receive(procup, requested_ids[procup],
360  procdown, request_to_fill);
361 
362  // Fill those requests
363  const unsigned int
364  sys_num = this->sys_number(),
365  n_var_groups = this->n_variable_groups();
366 
367  std::vector<dof_id_type> ghost_data
368  (request_to_fill.size() * 2 * n_var_groups);
369 
370  for (std::size_t i=0; i != request_to_fill.size(); ++i)
371  {
372  DofObject *requested = (this->*objects)(mesh, request_to_fill[i]);
373  libmesh_assert(requested);
374  libmesh_assert_equal_to (requested->processor_id(), this->processor_id());
375  libmesh_assert_equal_to (requested->n_var_groups(sys_num), n_var_groups);
376  for (unsigned int vg=0; vg != n_var_groups; ++vg)
377  {
378  unsigned int n_comp_g =
379  requested->n_comp_group(sys_num, vg);
380  ghost_data[i*2*n_var_groups+vg] = n_comp_g;
381  dof_id_type my_first_dof = n_comp_g ?
382  requested->vg_dof_base(sys_num, vg) : 0;
383  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (my_first_dof, DofObject::invalid_id);
384  ghost_data[i*2*n_var_groups+n_var_groups+vg] = my_first_dof;
385  }
386  }
387 
388  // Trade back the results
389  std::vector<dof_id_type> filled_request;
390  this->comm().send_receive(procdown, ghost_data,
391  procup, filled_request);
392 
393  // And copy the id changes we've now been informed of
394  libmesh_assert_equal_to (filled_request.size(),
395  requested_ids[procup].size() * 2 * n_var_groups);
396  for (std::size_t i=0; i != requested_ids[procup].size(); ++i)
397  {
398  DofObject *requested = (this->*objects)(mesh, requested_ids[procup][i]);
399  libmesh_assert(requested);
400  libmesh_assert_equal_to (requested->processor_id(), procup);
401  for (unsigned int vg=0; vg != n_var_groups; ++vg)
402  {
403  unsigned int n_comp_g =
404  cast_int<unsigned int>(filled_request[i*2*n_var_groups+vg]);
405  requested->set_n_comp_group(sys_num, vg, n_comp_g);
406  if (n_comp_g)
407  {
408  dof_id_type my_first_dof =
409  filled_request[i*2*n_var_groups+n_var_groups+vg];
410  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (my_first_dof, DofObject::invalid_id);
411  requested->set_vg_dof_base
412  (sys_num, vg, my_first_dof);
413  }
414  }
415  }
416  }
417 
418 #ifdef DEBUG
419  // Double check for invalid dofs
420  for (it = objects_begin; it != objects_end; ++it)
421  {
422  DofObject *obj = *it;
423  libmesh_assert (obj);
424  unsigned int num_variables = obj->n_vars(this->sys_number());
425  for (unsigned int v=0; v != num_variables; ++v)
426  {
427  unsigned int n_comp =
428  obj->n_comp(this->sys_number(), v);
429  dof_id_type my_first_dof = n_comp ?
430  obj->dof_number(this->sys_number(), v, 0) : 0;
431  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (my_first_dof, DofObject::invalid_id);
432  }
433  }
434 #endif
435 }

bool libMesh::DofMap::use_coupled_neighbor_dofs ( const MeshBase &  mesh) const

Tells other library functions whether or not this problem includes coupling between dofs in neighboring cells, as can currently be specified on the command line or inferred from the use of all discontinuous variables.

Definition at line 1604 of file dof_map.C.

References _implicit_neighbor_dofs, _implicit_neighbor_dofs_initialized, libMesh::FEAbstract::build(), libMesh::command_line_next(), libMesh::DISCONTINUOUS, libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension(), n_variables(), libMesh::on_command_line(), and variable_type().

1605 {
1606  // If we were asked on the command line, then we need to
1607  // include sensitivities between neighbor degrees of freedom
1608  bool implicit_neighbor_dofs =
1609  libMesh::on_command_line ("--implicit_neighbor_dofs");
1610 
1611  // If the user specifies --implicit_neighbor_dofs 0, then
1612  // presumably he knows what he is doing and we won't try to
1613  // automatically turn it on even when all the variables are
1614  // discontinuous.
1615  if (implicit_neighbor_dofs)
1616  {
1617  // No flag provided defaults to 'true'
1618  int flag = 1;
1619  flag = libMesh::command_line_next ("--implicit_neighbor_dofs", flag);
1620 
1621  if (!flag)
1622  {
1623  // The user said --implicit_neighbor_dofs 0, so he knows
1624  // what he is doing and really doesn't want it.
1625  return false;
1626  }
1627  }
1628 
1629  // Possibly override the commandline option, if set_implicit_neighbor_dofs
1630  // has been called.
1631  if(_implicit_neighbor_dofs_initialized)
1632  {
1633  implicit_neighbor_dofs = _implicit_neighbor_dofs;
1634 
1635  // Again, if the user explicitly says implicit_neighbor_dofs = false,
1636  // then we return here.
1637  if (!implicit_neighbor_dofs)
1638  return false;
1639  }
1640 
1641  // Look at all the variables in this system. If every one is
1642  // discontinuous then the user must be doing DG/FVM, so be nice
1643  // and force implicit_neighbor_dofs=true.
1644  {
1645  bool all_discontinuous_dofs = true;
1646 
1647  for (unsigned int var=0; var<this->n_variables(); var++)
1648  if (FEAbstract::build (mesh.mesh_dimension(),
1649  this->variable_type(var))->get_continuity() != DISCONTINUOUS)
1650  all_discontinuous_dofs = false;
1651 
1652  if (all_discontinuous_dofs)
1653  implicit_neighbor_dofs = true;
1654  }
1655 
1656  return implicit_neighbor_dofs;
1657 }

DofConstraints libMesh::DofMap::_dof_constraints
private

Data structure containing DOF constraints. The ith entry is the constraint matrix row for DOF i.

Definition at line 1378 of file dof_map.h.

Referenced by clear(), constraint_rows_begin(), constraint_rows_end(), find_connected_dofs(), is_constrained_dof(), stash_dof_constraints(), and unstash_dof_constraints().

CouplingMatrix* libMesh::DofMap::_dof_coupling

Degree of freedom coupling. If left empty each DOF couples to all others. Can be used to reduce memory requirements for sparse matrices. DOF 0 might only couple to itself, in which case dof_coupling(0,0) should be 1 and dof_coupling(0,j) = 0 for j not equal to 0.

This variable is named as though it were class private, but it is in the public interface. Also there are no public methods for accessing it... This typically means you should only use it if you know what you are doing.

Definition at line 1084 of file dof_map.h.

bool libMesh::ReferenceCounter::_enable_print_counter = true
staticprotectedinherited

Flag to control whether reference count information is printed when print_info is called.

std::vector<dof_id_type>* libMesh::DofMap::_n_nz
private

The number of on-processor nonzeros in my portion of the global matrix. If need_full_sparsity_pattern is true, this will just be a pointer into the corresponding sparsity pattern vector. Otherwise we have to new/delete it ourselves.
